Find out more about Hannah Brabon.Our video was shot for us by the awesome Little Boffin.Christopher EsberBeggren StudioDaweiNaya Rea

story:
Short Summary

At Up Attire Inc., we make socks. Not just ANY socks, mind you, these socks are, we believe, the best socks that money can buy… and what’s so special about these socks you might ask? They are of the very highest quality. We spent months working with hosiery industry veterans in North Carolina, Istanbul and Shanghai with decades of experience in socks. We evaluated countless different combinations of cotton and polyester with nylon/spandex variations.

Beyond that, we wanted to build a company that was true to arts and artists, and we wanted to give back to the community. THESE are the tenets that my wife and I had in mind when we began the company, our ‘raison d’être’. 

I have personally spent years working with various non-profits such as The Make-A-Wish Foundation and donating to St. Jude Children's Research Hospital. 

Today this mindset runs thoughout the company. we teamed up with Minnesota Viking’s Chad Greenway and his wife Jenni’s Lead The Way Foundation.   We created a style named after them from which 100% of net proceeds from sales went to and still go to the foundation. 

The Lead The Way Foundation works with several children's hospitals to offer life changing experiences to physically disabled and terminally ill children.  


Recently we worked with Trendy Butler and The Orphaned Starfish Foundation and provide hundreds of children with clothing and socks. Please check out our photos in the gallery. 

What We Need & What You Get

We want to raise $25,000 to expand into women's and children's lines, as well as double our men's assortment. This will cover the cost of raw materials such as cotton, dyes, packaging, etc. 

We’ve got some great incentives for you! Chief among them socks, of course! Buy a pair for your children, buy them for your grandparents, buy them for yourself and buy them for your dogs! There is nothing like a fresh pair of socks and I can promise you that these socks feel like no other. 

And if you value service above self as much as we do, we are offering a limited number of opportunities to "Name your sock" where we will offer you the opportunity to name your own sock and select a charity of your choosing which Up Attire will donate a significant portion of proceeds to for the life of that sock. Please note Up Attire Inc. does receive final approval authority of said naming and charity.

Other Ways You Can Help

If this isn't the right time for you to contribute, there are still ways you can help:

  • Spread the word! Share our Indiegogo link. 
  • Visit us on social media & share our story:
  • Facebook
  • Instagram 
  • Twitter 
  • Please check out the Lead The Way Foundation, Orphaned Starfish Foundation, and Make-A-Wish Foundation. 

And that's all there is to it. Thanks for time and attention. After all none of this would be possible without you.

story:
Bosom Galore is a UK manufactured luxury lingerie brand that specialises in small band and large cup sizes from 26E to 34H.

We were founded by Katy, a fellow small band and large cupped women who longed for luxury lingerie. However, with a 28 band size, such lingerie didn't exist in her size; the luxury lingerie industry doesn't cater for this size range.

"Of the few brands that offer small band and large cup sizes, their styles are frumpy or garish and composed of cheap fabrics that are coarse against the skin. I wanted something that is elegant, sophisticated and comfortable to wear"



With a background working in mental health, Katy approached her designs from a customer's perspective, creating what she wanted from her lingerie.

For the past 4 years we have worked meticulously to develop two high quality lingerie designs; our Amelia and Classique. Composed of premium fabrics these items provide a whole new level of comfort…

“Before Bosom Galore, I didn't know what high quality luxury lingerie felt like. I didn't know what I was missing. Now, for the first time in my life I can enjoy the experience of luxury and I could never go back! I am 100% converted…I’ve learned that it’s an investment in my comfort, happiness and self-esteem"



We saved, borrowed and begged to fund the development and manufacture of our first Bosom Galore lingerie collection, consisting of her Classique in red and Amelia in antique pink, now available to buy via our online shop.



We all deserve to experience luxury

We believe that luxury lingerie has the power to boost confidence and mood by offering beautiful fit, shape and comfort, and we feel that women of all shapes and sizes should have access to this experience.

We are starting with small band and large cup sizes with the aim to expand our size range to provide luxury for all sizes currently neglected by the lingerie industry.

Education
Lingerie satisfaction relies on sufficient support and comfort which is established through understanding how a bra should fit, and in particular, wearing a tight enough band. With our continually updated guidance and articles on our website, from our simple fitting guide to our bra size estimator, we aim to help women gain the very best from their lingerie.



We feel that it is important to support the UK manufacturing industry; the jobs it creates and the communities it supports.

We are therefore very proud that all of our Bosom Galore lingerie is manufactured in the UK.

Please see below a sneak peak behind the scenes of our UK manufacture.


Our aim is to provide women with a glorious array of beautiful lingerie in a variety of styles, colours and sizes.

Our long term plans are to provide maternity, mastectomy. swimwear and supportive nightwear in addition to dramatically expanding our size range.

The first step towards achieving these goals is producing our summer collection.


Our summer collection consists of our Classique in striking teal silk and black lace and our brand new black Louise harness style.



The product development and manufacture of our launch has exhausted all of our available funds. We therefore need your help to manufacture our summer collection.

Please help us in our  mission to provide gorgeous lingerie in a wide range of sizes and styles that has the power to elevate comfort and raise self-esteem.



Your support will enable us to buy the components and manufacture of our summer collection.

Our components will cost £1,600: 

  • 40 metres of rather expensive silk
  • 40 metres of our black Louise fabric
  • 300 metres of high quality soft lace
  • 1,000 meters of various elastics (all in different widths)
  • 600 bows
  • 600 hook and eyes
  • 200 meters of wire casing
  • 250 pairs of wires
  • 500 rings and slides
  • And a few other little bits and bobs that go into lingerie e.g. foam, mesh etc.

UK manufacture will cost £7,500

  • 232 bras
  • 120 knickers
  • 120 shorts
  • 120 thongs

Indiegogo's fee of £900:

The remaining £900 will be reserved for Indigogo's 9% fee.

By pre-ordering our stunning summer Classique in Teal or our gift vouchers at reduced prices you will be supporting not only the UK textiles industry but our pursuit to provide all women with quality lingerie.

Please take note of our size range.

View our full range of 'perks'



We understand that not everyone is in a position to offer financial support. However, if you would like to support our business and ethos please help us by spreading the word of our brand and funding campaign via word of mouth, social media and any other means that you can think of.

Please help us to reach women who would genuinely benefit from our lingerie.

We would like to take this opportunity to raise awareness of the following organisations that are very close to our hearts.


CoppaFeel! is a breast cancer awareness charity set up by Kristin Hallenga in 2009. At 22 Kristin was told she was “too young to get breast cancer”. This meant that her cancer was diagnosed late and could only be treated, never cured.

Visit CoppaFeel!’s website here
Learn how to check your boobs here
Register to get your free reminders here

Frip Ethique is an Oxfam-run social enterprise in Senegal. Most of the workers are women, who sort and sell clothes donated to Oxfam – including your bras – to local market traders.

Find out more here

story:
FASHION ENVIE

Heading into our 3rd installation, Beau Monde Society will be showcasing a fresh lineup of designers that are influenced by daily encounters, travel adventures, and commitment to sustainability. This year's theme/story is Warm Bodies. As the Creative Director/Founder of Fashion Envie, I was inspired by the inevitable outcome of climate change. Collaborating with past Fashion Envie 2013 designer, Tamara Leacock of Reciclagem NY, photographer Jubert Gilay and Makeup Pro artists, an avant-garde editorial with the same name was crafted to give the story an artistic countenance.  Fashion Envie's Warm Bodies will take place on April 17th at the Lighbox in New York City (www.lightbx.org).

"Fashion as a culture is the most meaningful medium to transmit new ideas. By bringing eco-fashion into the mainstream, Fashion Envie's mission is to provide a platform for these grassroots designers as well as creating a F.U.N landscape to ensure its longevity and impact towards a sustainable future. By joining our annual ecoventure, you can support Fashion Envie by making a contribution and/or spreading the word about our exciting eco-collective."

A Symbiotic Relationship

By joining our ecoventure, you can leave a positive impact:

  • From our previous installations, the overall budget to cover total expenses has grown to $3,000 as other demands and overheads have arisen which include but are not limited to the location rental expenses, event setup/props, publicity, and promotional materials. 
  • Global Perspective: BMS aligns our mission each year with a social venture organization or a non-profit (depending on the theme) to extend our message globally. This year's installation will benefit WaterAid International.
  • PERKS:Our perks include special discount at Oasis Juice Bar in Harlem NYC, FREE tickets to attend Fashion Envie 2015, and a gift basket of assorted ethical brands valued at $150.
  • Even if we don't reach our expected goal, the funds raised play an instrumental role in executing a successful event. 

The Impact

  • Fashion Envie is a unique and fashion forward platform that showcases designers within a curated space. Fashion Envie meaning Fashion, Environment, and Life, highlights the interdependent relationship between these three important components. 
  • Going into our 3rd installment, Fashion Envie has grown to new heights. We have been sponsored by such amazing brands such as PRITI NYC, Vita Coco, One With Nature, J.F Lazartigue, etc. Also, we have worked with social ventures such as Skraptacular (www.skraptacular.org) and WeCyclers (www.wecyclers.com) for our first two installations. 
  • Our goal is to create a FUN atmosphere for all of our guests to enjoy--to have an experience like none other. A fashion presentation that awakens the senses and propagates the inevitable truth of efforts that our designers have taken to reduce environmental waste. By fusing fashion, art, and music, we have successfully created a platform that would showcase designers in a memorable and inspiring light.

Risks & Challenges

In creating a unique fashion presentation featuring eco-friendly designs, there have been some challenges and risks. 

  • Challenges that have arisen is lack of familiarity with the designers and for some companies, the inability to allot funds/products due to their budgetary limitations, and increasing our press reach-- once again due to lack of familiarity. However, resiliency and consistency has yielded positive results. 
  • Sponsors are eager to support a platform such as FE due to the lack of representation for eco-friendly designers.ther challenges that have arisen is lack of familiarity with the designers and for some, the inability to allot funds/products due to budgetary limitations, and increasing our press reach-- once again due to lack of familiarity.
  • Suitable location: FE's aesthetics thrive in a blank art space where we are able to transform the event space into our eco-collective theme. Finding suitable and affordable locations have become very rare and difficult. 
  • By building an information press packet, sponsors are made aware of our past progress as well as future goals that we aim to accomplish through Fashion Envie. Another effective way to increase our press reach include and are not limited to expanding our network, expanding our search for writers passionate about the environment, and locations that would increase our overall reach as well.

How you can help:

  • Support our campaign by placing a monetary contribution.
  • Share our indiegogo links as much as you can on all your social media platforms by using the Indiegogo share tools!
  • Support the locally-based designers that work with Beau Monde Society and other small businesses in your area.

story:
Our backpack is designed using only the highest quality materials and handcrafted by professionals. There are no doubts that our product can be used for a long time, which is why we provide a lifetime guarantee for our customers. If backpack is damaged or just worn our customers can send the old bag to us and receive absolutely new instead

 

 

The TYROZE backpack is designed specially to separate your clothes from your accessories and gadgets. TYROZE includes a 15'' portable laptop bag and hanging toiletry bag  which can be used separately daily or while traveling. Separate shoe case with air conditioning. 

Special place for your own powerbank with a USB external charger.

 

 

The TYROZE backpack looks perfect in various combinations of business, sporty, casual or formal looks.

 

Highly functional with numerous compartments specially designed to look slim even if it’s full

You can wear the TYROZE backpack while riding a bike, attending a meeting or when just out and about on the street.

 

Made ergonomically with high-quality eco leather which will make you look and feel good. It is eco friendly and long lasting, as we truly care about animals.

SKA (trademark) - premium Italian smooth black nickel double zipper placed on the back of the backpack to prevent the theft of your personal items.

 

It doesn’t really matter what the weather is like - your clothes and gadgets will always stay dry.

 

Compact luggage size with huge capacity.

 

 


 

 

 

 

It’s funny to say this, especially when talking about a crowdfunding project, but there are no risks or hidden obstacles. We produce a backpack, not a complicated electronic device or smart gadget. We have our own production with our own professional team. We have no minimal batch or minimal funding goal. We’ve set the aim at $1,000 solely to reduce our production costs. We can produce one to thousands and millions of items... it only depends on time. 

As such, you can be sure that you’ll get your TYROZE backpack.

story:
At one point all pregnant women experience that awkward pregnancy stage where people aren’t quite sure if you went overboard on donut Wednesdays at the office.  That’s what inspired our brand.   "It's all baby" serves both moms and moms-to-be with active wear and tees that are perfect for being out and about, going to the gym, or lounging on the couch eating hot wings and pickles (or in my case cheese and mayo sandwiches).  

We initially catered to maternity, however we've expanded to include both expectant and non-expectant mothers to better serve our audience.

Right now our selection is small, but like that baby bump we have room to grow!  We currently need backings for a small inventory.  Our ultimate goal is to expand the maternity portion of our line. To start, your backings can help out with:

 
Note: Any funds beyond our target will go back into the business and toward expansion.
 
 

Maternity shirts

Comfortable, breathable, and stretchy with side-rouching

 

 
 
 
 

Tanks and Tees

Perfect for non-expectant moms and early pregnancy

 

 

           

        

We face two major challenges:  

1.  Cost of shipping and handling

Currently, we do not have the most efficient model to ship directly from printing, which drives up costs and shipping time.  We want to get our prices as low as possible and customers' products to them as quickly as possible!  

2.  Obtaining wholesale maternity clothes.  

The maternity active wear niche is currently dominated by one or two primary players, so it's very difficult to find the right maternity shirt.  Thus, we either need to create our own garments or purchase in VERY large bulk from a specialized manufacturer.  This is a foreseeable future as our company grows.

story:
After desperately look for the wallet with an easy and quick access, that we have never found, We decided to create our own wallet that combined all these features with an appealing design. Here's how Fold was born. To highlight these qualities and to give it the longest possible duration of life we have decided to use quality materials such as thick fabric resistant to water. Cork or Vegan Leather for its chic and its strength allows it to be both durable and stylish.

 

WHAT OUR BUYERS SAY

Neil C.
"Received in UK already. Very impressed with quality and attention to detail! :)"
Pierre K.
"I receive mine yesterday. What a great choice of products. It's so light. Thank you"
Joseph D. 
"looks and feels quality, looking forward to putting it through my daily routine. Thanks!"

 

AS FAST AS YOUR THUMB

We created the first cascading wallet that works with only the thumb in 2016 !
Press with your thumb on the cards and made a movement up and down until the cards appear in cascading. This is really cool !

 

FOLD IT OR NOT

The first wallet that fits your needs. You can fold it in one direction or the other, as it matters to you.

You go on a trip, just open it and slip your passport, tickets and anything else.

 

THE DESIGN

 

 

 

MULTITUDE OF COLORS

The FOLD is available in two colors and materials. One for everybody.

Back : black fabric and black synthetic leather

Natural Cork : blue cobalt fabric and natural cork

 

GALLERY

 

Shipping Details

All parcels are sent by letter. We usually use LA POSTE to ship our wallets. 
It normally takes approximately 3-10 working days (monday to friday) for arrival in Europe. 5-15 working days (monday to friday) for USA and Canada. Until 25 working days (monday to friday) for the reste of the world.

For any question please send us a message
and we would be more than happy to reply as soon as we can :-)
story_txt: After desperately look for the wallet with an easy and quick access, that we have never found, We decided to create our own wallet that combined all these features with an appealing design. Here's how Fold was born. To highlight these qualities and to give it the longest possible duration of life we have decided to use quality materials such as thick fabric resistant to water. Cork or Vegan Leather for its chic and its strength allows it to be both durable and stylish. WHAT OUR BUYERS SAYNeil C."Received in UK already. Very impressed with quality and attention to detail! :)"Pierre K."I receive mine yesterday. What a great choice of products. It's so light. Thank you"Joseph D. "looks and feels quality, looking forward to putting it through my daily routine. Thanks!" AS FAST AS YOUR THUMBWe created the first cascading wallet that works with only the thumb in 2016 !Press with your thumb on the cards and made a movement up and down until the cards appear in cascading. story:
It´s not getting any easier. We are on the verge of giving up. Giving up on trying to be rich
enough to buy a 33 Stradale or a DB5 instead of a new house. We have accepted that
The Italian Job  (No no no, the original one from 1969) is the closest we'll ever be from
most of the beauties we relish so much.

But even if the opportunity is not there, the passion is. Stronger than ever.



A brand that allows you to take your passions with you.
Even to bed. Along with your wife.
━
Designed for the ones that skip a beat when something exotic drives by. For the ones that look beyond the wheels and see art. Socks inspired by the most iconic cars, bikes, planes, boats and everything with pistons in it. From the taillights, trunks and propellers, we get the patterns, textures and colors.
━
Few of us will ever have the chance to sit in a 250 GTO, but you are surely entitled to wear it.

Produced in Portugal and delivered by a trustworthy team with over 20 years' experience
in the business. A team with the necessary Petrol-Head skills.

We use seamless toe knitting to create a sock without any stitches. With 80% Combed Cotton, 17% Polyamide and 3% Elastane, beautiful inside and out. After you've worn it a few times, you won’t be able to go back to anything else.

As soon as the campaign is over we'll contact you so you can choose the sock models and sizes that you pledged to.



We're still in first gear and need your help to pick up speed. Our manufacturers only work at scale so we need to have a minimum figure to start production. Help us reach a minimum order quantity.

Allow this dream to come true and be one of the first to receive a pair.



Because we should never shy away from love. Because we should be proud of what we are passionate about. Because these are the only socks that provide a unique improving performance during the "Oh my god shizzle dizzle".

We've been working with our sock manufacturer for a year now. Dozens of tests have
been made to prototypes until we found something we’re proud to bring you.

The socks you see in the pictures are production-ready and we'll start producing them
as soon as we can raise funds for production. We estimate the following timeline:




Our team has a strong experience on similar projects. Some have founded a company
that makes and delivers customized shoes in 2 weeks. Now that's a challenge!

Some have substantial experience in Fast Moving Consumer Goods Supply Chain,
managing more than 15 different plants.

We have full confidence in our factory that has been knitting socks for more than 20 years.
Almost as good as your grandmother.

Why I want HEEL TREAD to succeed?

Because I want meeting rooms to be less boring, I want people to take their passions
everywhere, because the concept is awesome, because look at these socks!!
I was a dark blue and black socks guy for 37 years.

NO MORE!

Oh, and yes, I’m a real Petrol Head, the kind that looks like a dog every time
I hear an engine revving.

My life experience and how it can help HEEL TREAD succeed:

I have ten years of experience in Logistics and Fast-Moving consumer goods (look at the name!). Sourcing, designing and delivering all kinds of products, from end products to promotional gifts, this allows me to ensure that your socks have a perfect quality and are produced at the right time at the right cost.

Finally, I've spent the last two years building a startup that makes customized shoes in just two weeks, so I'm sure I can manage all the challenges of this project.

Facebook • Instagram • Twitter

story:
Did you know?

Over 70% of earth’s surface is covered by water, but 97% of this water is in our oceans.  Only  1% of earth’s water is readily fresh and attainable. Each WaterSply bracelet contains a drop of ocean water in the central blue bead featuring our logo, to raise awareness of this extreme imbalance. Furthermore, 10% of our global population doesn't have access to clean water.  That's over 700 million people who are suffering day in and day out without access to our most basic need!  Even worse, a child dies every 90 seconds due to a water related illness.   

Our Story:

In 2009, co-founder and CEO of WaterSply, Jon Berry’s determination to start a social venture was sparked after hearing a lecture from the Founder and CEO of Charity: Water, Scott Harrison. Berry became aware of the ongoing water crisis that affects more than 700 million people around the globe.

“I couldn’t quite wrap my head around the idea that so many people could not obtain their most essential need: Water. There I was, complaining about what my mom was making for dinner, while hundreds of millions of people continue to suffer from the inability to obtain clean water,” Berry says.

Our goal is to unite people across the globe with our stylish, ocean-water filled bracelets to create a sense of togetherness that can overcome this worldwide crisis.  Every product that we come out with will be created with the same goal.  To put an end to our earth’s water crisis we call upon you! It will take recognition and action from millions of people around the world, and it starts here. 

Contributions:

The contributions we receive will be going to:

  1. The funding of fresh water wells and our travels to the areas they are constructed to provide aid
  2. The funding of our new water-oriented apparel, jewelry and accessory line (currently in the works, stay tuned!)
  3. The implementation of a drop of water from the 5 major oceans (Atlantic, Pacific, Southern, Arctic and Indian) into our WaterSply Bracelet to show the extreme imbalance of available water on our planet vs. the amount of people in need of it
  4. Our travels around the United States in pursuit of raising awareness about the severity of this issue

Remember to claim your perk to receive your WaterSply Bracelet (free shipping within the US)! 

For every $100 in contributions we receive, we will be able to help provide water to a child in need for their entire life through the funding of fresh water wells!

It costs approximately $4800 to build a well that provides clean water to an entire community for many generations. The more money we raise, the more people we can help!

TOGETHER WE CAN CHANGE THE WORLD, ONE DROP AT A TIME!

Follow us on Instagram @WaterSply and like us on Facebook @WaterSply or check out our blog Waterfall The World on our website www.watersply.com to follow our journey!

 

The Bracelet:

 

A message from our sponsoring charity LIFE Outreach International:

 

"Many people say that bad water is a “silent killer”, but it’s only silent if you’re not one of the over 700 million people that don’t have access to clean, safe water.  This so-called “silent killer” claims the lives of roughly 7 million people each year. That means that in the amount of time it has taken you to read this paragraph, someone, somewhere in the world has died as a result of dirty water." "Did you know that in areas without access to water, it is estimated that women and young girls walk up to 7 miles and spend an average of 6 hours per day collecting water for their families? It’s estimated that 200 million working hours are spent each day just to collect the water needed for survival. Unfortunately though the water they work so hard to collect, to keep their families alive is also the thing killing their children.  Waterborne diseases account for an estimated 60% of infant deaths worldwide.  Could you imagine being that mother walking 7 miles a day just to bring your baby muddy water that ultimately kills him?"

WaterSply's Impact

Donate Today!

 

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help!

We appreciate any and all support. If you'd like to help, but cannot donate monetarily, we'd love to get you involved within The WaterSply Team. Send an email to onedrop@watersply.com to inquire. In the meantime, you can help by sharing our campaign and getting the word out to others. Educating people of this crisis is the first step!

story:
The watches are already PRODUCED!
Delivery immediately after ordering.
This campaign will be closed March 2020.
 


Welcome to the page of our second watch project – Umbra! Last year, the magic moment happened – several hundred backers across the world and platforms supported our first campaign, giving Gnomon a boost in life and engendering the history of a new brand in independent watchmaking – a one-hander inspired by the real sundial of ancient times. 
 

 

The most important thing we learned in the process of this fascinating journey is that dreams can come true! And yet, as long as there are people in the world who appreciate our efforts and share our vision, the desire to create will never disappear. You have given us a chance; now we are offering you a new watch that will diversify your collection and, we hope, will be remembered by each of you for a long time!  
 

 

Please meet our freshest creation and the ultimate manifestation of a Solar Lab watch — the single-hand automatic Umbra timepieces.
 


We traversed the whole school of creating watches – gathering like-minded people willing to put faith in us, sending the first Gnomons to their first owners, receiving a lot of positive feedback and gratitude, studying all the stages of production, and gaining new important experience. Now we are ready for more! :) 


There are no better endorsers of our watches than satisfied supporters, who received our first Gnomons and shared their positive feedback with us. 


Feedback from the first campaign


But enough beating around the bush. It's better see it with your own eyes! If you're intrigued, let's proceed!

 

 


"Umbra" means "shadow" in Latin and is a direct reference to the inspirational sources we drew upon. It connects the idea of shadow play on ancient sundials to contemporary technologies and an up-to-date wristwatch format.

SILVER UMBRA WATCH

 

Imagining a new look for our follow-up collection, we wanted to make the new watch look the way it might be found in the exhibition halls of ancient times or at historical dig sites as contemporaries of antediluvian people. We closed our eyes and simply tried to imagine how your regular patrician would look in our watches. And here's the result! 
 


The initial line-up for the Umbra series consists of three models — Silver, Black, and Rose Gold. We chose these color combinations as a nod to materials used in artisanal crafts and sculptures in Ancient times, including marble, granite, copper, and alabaster.


BLACK UMBRA WATCH

 

Alabaster and marble were source materials for making statues and sculptures during the most ancient of times. Copper is considered to be the first metal used in artisanal work and in creative endeavors of people from the distant past. The pitch blackness of granite stone was used to decorate and build with style and power, and this is also reflected in the Umbra color way range.


The renewed design refers to a layout of a common ancient sundial. The time disc is only partly visible, since sundials are “functional” only from dawn till dusk, and the design refers to this part of the day. Working on the watch, we studied a lot of images and notes of the well-know historical examples of sundials of the past and found new sources of inspiration for our watches, thanks to ancient designers from civilizations across the world :) In the Umbra look you can find references to such sundials as created by Anaximander of Miletus, the sundial of the Valley of the Kings, designs suggested by Aristarchus of Samos and even the relic Chinese sundials from Han and Zhou dynasties’ epochs.

ROSE GOLD UMBRA WATCH

 

 

Now that we've finished with the introductions, why not learn more about the concept behind Umbra?

Our first series of watches was based on the simple but very charming and entertaining idea of embodying an ancient sundial in a wristwatch-shaped object. Considering how much people liked our previous Gnomons, this time we decided to work on improvements and implement unrealized ideas, and to enable you to look at the sundial from a totally different angle and integrate it in your everyday carry. 
 


With each of our watches we want to offer to all watch enthusiasts not only a custom design, but also a fresh look at time itself. That's why the time disc that constantly rotates on the dial is moving backwards, defying tradition, as if the time is flying through the sundial's surface. However, it won't make it more difficult for you to tell the time – with a little practice you'll be reading minutes as if you had been wearing it for ages! 
 


The new collection has become even closer to the initial concept, turning the watch face into the ultimate sundial representation, both in its design and function. The gnomon-style single hand stands still, serving as a shadow pointer as well on the authentically-crafted dial resembling actual ancient time-tellers. 
 


Telling time is a piece of cake – see for yourself! 


And this is not all that Umbra can offer you! ;) 

We want your watches to look decent and appropriate in any situation, so we have erased the boundary between casual and luxury, combining classical techniques, modern solutions, handmade elements, and motifs that are typical of overpriced watches. Yes, we offer you a new experience in the perception of time, but at the same time we make sure that you are as comfortable and familiar with it as possible. 
 


We are pleased that, as independent watchmakers, we can afford to make our timepieces look the way they were intended. Given the handcrafted and almost antique appearance of our watches, we try to add as many small details and nuances to the design as possible. Each one is a stroke in the overall canvas of the signature Solar Lab style that we want you to experience.


We have slightly modified our trad case, which was created from scratch for the Gnomon series – now it has become more practical and convenient. The back lid is decorated with zodiac engraving and transparent tinted glass matching the color of the model and revealing the mesmerizing work of the automatic movement. 
 


The Umbra dial develops the ideas of our previous project and shows the time with the help of a fixed gnomon needle located above a polymer disc, with a texture and palette referring to materials that ancient architects worked with – marble, precious metals, and granite. 
 


Once again, Umbra revealed that it was not the simplest watch in design. Changing the very principle of telling time allowed us to make our new chronometers even more multi-layered and monumental. The dial consists of several application layers and volumetric elements that work organically with each other and were selected for you through a method of many months of trial and error. We hope our design research will make you happy! :)
 


Another important feature is the new straps. The silver Umbra is accompanied by a coffee-colored strap; the gold, by the colors of dark chocolate with an aged texture; while the black one has inherited the everlasting classics – a stylish black strap. All straps are stitched and made of whole pieces of leather, so you don’t need to worry about the strap getting torn or becoming unglued. The main thing is to treat it carefully! ;) 
 


Speaking of straps... 

Considering the feedback from the previous campaign, we decided to work on our straps to make your experience with Solar Lab even more pleasant. We think we were able to achieve that goal! 
 


Yes, we changed the supplier. This time we are being helped with the production of our Umbra straps by the world-famous Chicago tannery Horween! One of the values aspired to by our team is to make watches with more soulfulness and with less a feeling of cold factory production. Horween leather straps were the perfect solution.
 

All straps for your future watches are made by hand from premium cowhide, tanned and aged in Horween workshops. Chicago leather is remarkable for its properties: being durable and thick, it remains soft and supple, which is very important when used in watch straps.
 


The Horween name is a guarantee of quality with which you can feel confident about the life of a strap after long wear. Among the clients of Horween, which has been in business for more than a century, are such powerful names as Timberland, Rawlings, Wilson Sporting Goods, Brooks Brothers, Hanover Shoe, and dozens of other distinguished customers who have trusted the leather company for decades. Now included among them is Solar Lab! :) 
 


Let's summarize everything you learned about our new watches. :)   

Umbra is an automatic mechanical watch in a one-hand format, working on a disk system and referring to the ancient sundial in its design. The starting line-up consists of three characteristic models, in black, white, and rose-gold. 

 

 

Each watch is made of lightweight 316L steel – thanks to this they feel almost weightless and offer maximum wearing comfort. The color on the Rose Gold and Black models is applied by a durable vacuum-deposition method that will last you for many years with proper care of the watch. Designed from scratch for our Gnomon series, the case is protected by solid mineral glass with a sapphire coating and is water resistant for 5 ATM. For precise time-telling, we chose an automatic Japanese-made Seiko automatic gear. 
 

 

More detailed specifications of the new collection can be found below.

Case Diameter: 43 mm   
Case Thickness: 11 mm 
Band Material: Cowskin Horween leather (Made in USA) 
Band Width: 20 mm narrowing to 18 mm
Total Weight: 60 gram 
Case Material / Buckle: 316L Stainless Steel with IP coating
Crystal: Sapphire Coated 
Movement: Seiko NH35 Automatic
Water Resistant: 5 ATM / 50 Meters

 

Thanks to the reach that crowdfunding platforms grant to young entrepreneurs, we are able to offer our backers the most attractive price on any Umbra watch. Considering our previous experience, the choice of the manufacturer and suppliers, and a hand-made approach to the creation of some elements, we offer the special price range of $260-285 for the watch depending, on the color which is much more economical than many other watches in a similar price segment! You will receive the watch directly from us, at a fair price and without any additional charges. The best time to buy new Umbra is now! :) 

Not being a rookie in the crowdfunding area anymore and having experienced all the charms and shortcomings of the production process, Solar Lab can provide you with a realistic campaign plan – from your pledge to our watches hitting your wrist! :) The watches will be delivered this November already!

By purchasing Umbra during the campaign, you can save 30% and be among one of the first in the world to get this watch! The discount becomes even bigger if you choose a bundle with multiple hours – up to 50%! 

Be sure to join our communities on social networks to stay up to date with current news and events, as well as to receive cool new pictures from Solar Lab. And, if you like our new project Umbra, we would be very grateful if you shared it with your friends and subscribers. Every voice is important! 

instagram.com/solarlab.co

facebook.com/solarlab.co

twitter.com/solarlab_co

If you write articles about watches or design, run a blog or just want to know more, you can contact us by mail at info@solarlab.co, or in any other way convenient for you. You can find pictures in high resolution for your materials on our website or after inquiry.

The pitch blackness of granite stone was used to decorate and build with style and power, and this is also reflected in the Umbra color way range.The renewed design refers to a layout of a common ancient sundial. The time disc is only partly visible, since sundials are “functional” only from dawn till dusk, and the design refers to this part of the day. Working on the watch, we studied a lot of images and notes of the well-know historical examples of sundials of the past and found new sources of inspiration for our watches, thanks to ancient designers from civilizations across the world :) In the Umbra look you can find references to such sundials as created by Anaximander of Miletus, the sundial of the Valley of the Kings, designs suggested by Aristarchus of Samos and even the relic Chinese sundials from Han and Zhou dynasties’ epochs.ROSE GOLD UMBRA WATCH  Now that we've finished with the introductions, why not learn more about the concept behind Umbra?Our first series of watches was based on the simple but very charming and entertaining idea of embodying an ancient sundial in a wristwatch-shaped object. Considering how much people liked our previous Gnomons, this time we decided to work on improvements and implement unrealized ideas, and to enable you to look at the sundial from a totally different angle and integrate it in your everyday carry.  With each of our watches we want to offer to all watch enthusiasts not only a custom design, but also a fresh look at time itself. That's why the time disc that constantly rotates on the dial is moving backwards, defying tradition, as if the time is flying through the sundial's surface. However, it won't make it more difficult for you to tell the time – with a little practice you'll be reading minutes as if you had been wearing it for ages!  The new collection has become even closer to the initial concept, turning the watch face into the ultimate sundial representation, both in its design and function. The gnomon-style single hand stands still, serving as a shadow pointer as well on the authentically-crafted dial resembling actual ancient time-tellers.  Telling time is a piece of cake – see for yourself! And this is not all that Umbra can offer you! ;) We want your watches to look decent and appropriate in any situation, so we have erased the boundary between casual and luxury, combining classical techniques, modern solutions, handmade elements, and motifs that are typical of overpriced watches. Yes, we offer you a new experience in the perception of time, but at the same time we make sure that you are as comfortable and familiar with it as possible.  We are pleased that, as independent watchmakers, we can afford to make our timepieces look the way they were intended. Given the handcrafted and almost antique appearance of our watches, we try to add as many small details and nuances to the design as possible. Each one is a stroke in the overall canvas of the signature Solar Lab style that we want you to experience.We have slightly modified our trad case, which was created from scratch for the Gnomon series – now it has become more practical and convenient. The back lid is decorated with zodiac engraving and transparent tinted glass matching the color of the model and revealing the mesmerizing work of the automatic movement.  The Umbra dial develops the ideas of our previous project and shows the time with the help of a fixed gnomon needle located above a polymer disc, with a texture and palette referring to materials that ancient architects worked with – marble, precious metals, and granite.  Once again, Umbra revealed that it was not the simplest watch in design. Changing the very principle of telling time allowed us to make our new chronometers even more multi-layered and monumental. The dial consists of several application layers and volumetric elements that work organically with each other and were selected for you through a method of many months of trial and error. We hope our design research will make you happy! :) Another important feature is the new straps. The silver Umbra is accompanied by a coffee-colored strap; the gold, by the colors of dark chocolate with an aged texture; while the black one has inherited the everlasting classics – a stylish black strap. All straps are stitched and made of whole pieces of leather, so you don’t need to worry about the strap getting torn or becoming unglued. The main thing is to treat it carefully! ;)  Speaking of straps... Considering the feedback from the previous campaign, we decided to work on our straps to make your experience with Solar Lab even more pleasant. We think we were able to achieve that goal!  Yes, we changed the supplier. This time we are being helped with the production of our Umbra straps by the world-famous Chicago tannery Horween! One of the values aspired to by our team is to make watches with more soulfulness and with less a feeling of cold factory production. Horween leather straps were the perfect solution. All straps for your future watches are made by hand from premium cowhide, tanned and aged in Horween workshops. Chicago leather is remarkable for its properties: being durable and thick, it remains soft and supple, which is very important when used in watch straps. The Horween name is a guarantee of quality with which you can feel confident about the life of a strap after long wear. Among the clients of Horween, which has been in business for more than a century, are such powerful names as Timberland, Rawlings, Wilson Sporting Goods, Brooks Brothers, Hanover Shoe, and dozens of other distinguished customers who have trusted the leather company for decades. Now included among them is Solar Lab! :)  Let's summarize everything you learned about our new watches. :)   Umbra is an automatic mechanical watch in a one-hand format, working on a disk system and referring to the ancient sundial in its design. The starting line-up consists of three characteristic models, in black, white, and rose-gold.   Each watch is made of lightweight 316L steel – thanks to this they feel almost weightless and offer maximum wearing comfort. The color on the Rose Gold and Black models is applied by a durable vacuum-deposition method that will last you for many years with proper care of the watch. Designed from scratch for our Gnomon series, the case is protected by solid mineral glass with a sapphire coating and is water resistant for 5 ATM. For precise time-telling, we chose an automatic Japanese-made Seiko automatic gear.   More detailed specifications of the new collection can be found below.Case Diameter: 43 mm   Case Thickness: 11 mm Band Material: Cowskin Horween leather (Made in USA) Band Width: 20 mm narrowing to 18 mmTotal Weight: 60 gram Case Material / Buckle: 316L Stainless Steel with IP coatingCrystal: Sapphire Coated Movement: Seiko NH35 AutomaticWater Resistant: 5 ATM / 50 Meters Thanks to the reach that crowdfunding platforms grant to young entrepreneurs, we are able to offer our backers the most attractive price on any Umbra watch. Considering our previous experience, the choice of the manufacturer and suppliers, and a hand-made approach to the creation of some elements, we offer the special price range of $260-285 for the watch depending, on the color which is much more economical than many other watches in a similar price segment! You will receive the watch directly from us, at a fair price and without any additional charges. The best time to buy new Umbra is now! :) Not being a rookie in the crowdfunding area anymore and having experienced all the charms and shortcomings of the production process, Solar Lab can provide you with a realistic campaign plan – from your pledge to our watches hitting your wrist! :) The watches will be delivered this November already!By purchasing Umbra during the campaign, you can save 30% and be among one of the first in the world to get this watch! The discount becomes even bigger if you choose a bundle with multiple hours – up to 50%! Be sure to join our communities on social networks to stay up to date with current news and events, as well as to receive cool new pictures from Solar Lab. And, if you like our new project Umbra, we would be very grateful if you shared it with your friends and subscribers. Every voice is important! instagram.com/solarlab.cofacebook.com/solarlab.cotwitter.com/solarlab_coIf you write articles about watches or design, run a blog or just want to know more, you can contact us by mail at info@solarlab.co, or in any other way convenient for you. You can find pictures in high resolution for your materials on our website or after inquiry.

story:
INTRODUCTION

ABOUT ME

My name is David. I'm 34 years old. 

Everything started to shift for me in November 2016. It was a cold winter night. The moon just completed a cycle and turned full and on this particular night, I died. 

The experience cannot be defined by words. Those who have been initiated by shamans to the use of sacred medicine would maybe understand this.  But yes, on that night, I died. Not literally, but symbolically.

Overnight, all the knowledge, all the beliefs, ll the securities, all of that made this world and me 'ME', felt suddenly, as intangible as the stories that parents would tell their children to fall asleep. Yes, on that night, the old me died and as the light of dawn came through, a new world was birthed in me with new hopes, new dreams, new perspectives. 

Yes, I was reborn. 

The changes did not come into my life as suddenly as the visions. They came in slowly and progressively. It started with lots of emotions felt also physically. For instance. I started feeling my heart again. It's a funny observation, but actually, how often do we consciously feel it's beat and it's warmth? Then, I saw my usual habits become unnecessary and almost too heavy to pursue. The need to 'reprogram' came quite naturally.

Slowly, progressively and steadily my entire life changed so then by the middle of the year of 2017, I was no longer lead by my emotions, but rather I was existing as them. The new friends, old souls an communities that I met on the road, they were all involved in at least one creative, artistic or community oriented project. 

Meeting these people who inspired a new vibration of connecting, a new structure of living felt like I was finally starting to come home to my soul.  I felt inspired, held and nourished. I really wanted to be like them. And after another year of exploration and learning, this project came into existence. 

ABOUT OUR PROJECTS

How they came into existence and why it is important for us to see you join the movement

Throughout the years of 2017 and 2018, I evolved and immersed myself within the ‘spiritual’ and ‘conscious’ community. I got to witness and experience the life of one who seeks for personal growth and a healthier lifestyle. Through the process, it struck me that people [myself included] went for so many mindful changes in their lives, yet seemed to have forgotten the most obvious element, the one that they’d carry on them all day, everyday : their clothes ?! 

How could this be ? 

There are three basic needs that man possesses : food, clothing and shelter. The global textile and clothing industry is bound to be big as it fulfills the second basic requirement of the human race. It is worth $480 billion at present and is expected to reach $700 billion, shortly. This is because people are being increasingly conscious of the way they dress. It has become a means to create an impression and represent one’s personality.

But what not many people know, is that the textile industry is also one of the most pollutant releasing industries of the world. Surveys show that nearly 5% of all landfill space is consumed by textile waste. Besides, 20% of all freshwater pollution is made by textile treatment and dyeing. And another alarming fact; Surveys show that cotton consumes the highest amount of harmful pesticides and fertilisers, yet it is one of the most common fabrics that is on offer, and that we wear. 

And I’ve not yet mentioned the inhumane conditions in which employees usually work in. Did you know for example, that typical hours for a textile industry employee range from 10-18 hours per day and up to 80 hours a week, and require additional overtime hours to meet strict company deadlines ?! How could this be tolerated by anyone ? It’s modern age slavery. 

Yes, there are a number of dysfunctionalities out there in the world, that are in serious need of being addressed if we are to stay in this world for much longer. But out of the many, I found myself needing to cover this one as a start to my new personal sense of responsibility to cover the many.  This one is enormous. 

Also, to the question : How could this be ? I found in my researches that it was not so much about a lack of options, because there are number of ethical and sustainable fashion brands out there.  But I found that after the cost and designs of the products, people would actually take the step for the change, if they were diligently informed about the consequences of their choice, and if they had a genuine feeling of contributing to a good cause, with an even stronger feeling of being part of something bigger than themselves.

This is why Bridging Worlds and One Earth One Tribe came into existence. They are here to occupy space by addressing the particular points of education and belonging. This is why it is important for you too to join the movement and to support us One Earth One Tribe. Together, let’s we can make the change happen. 

 

BRIDGING WORLDS 

A  UNIQUE FASHION LABEL THAT’S REALLY WORTH YOUR SUPPORT

In a sentence, what is Bridging Worlds about ? 

Bridging Worlds is a fashion label that holds the vision to re-humanize the textile industry with an approach that is ethical and sustainable, in alignment with the ‘slow-fashion revolution’. 

How does Bridging Worlds stand out from other ethical and sustainable fashion labels ? 

At Bridging Worlds, we have an overarching for wholeness that leads us to choose :

- To select natural fabrics that also don’t require any intensive and damageable process to the environment to produce. Hemp, Linen and Tencel being the main materials.

- To support small local business in Thailand where we source our fabrics and most of our accessories. 

- To  dye our fabrics accordingly to Thai traditions with elements of nature that are grown locally : including bark, flowers, …

- To embroider by hand the patterns as this is also part of Thai culture. 

Why does Bridging Worlds want to collaborate with tribal tattoo artists ? What is the main message behind this ? 

According to tribal customs and traditions, receiving a tattoo marked the passage into womanhood and manhood. Often times, these tattoos depicted a social status, a family identification and a spiritual message. Receiving such a tattoo was seen by the community as very important. 

At Bridging Worlds, we see so much value in these practices that we wanted to, in a way, transfer these intentions to our clothing and brand. This is why we’ve invited international tattoo artists to join our project and design the patterns to our garments.

You’ll find that each of our garments have a unique style and story to tell. At the same time, they all emphasize on the same powerful message : 

That you are all Queens and Kings, Goddesses and Gods. Sovereign. Free. Liberated. Belonging to the greater family of One Earth One Tribe and indissociable to the One Consciousness.

What other causes will you be supporting with Bridging Worlds ?

Bridging Worlds is openly and actively supporting :

- Disenfranchised populations. In this case, we’re showing our support to the hilltribe people of Thailand with a job opportunity that is fairly paid and that also empowers them in their traditions.

- Women’s Rights with a policy based on Equal Rights. In result, most of the key and strategic positions are being occupied by women, this came to be on the basis of their professional and human skills, regardless of their gender.

- LGBTQ Rights. In effect, we are very happy to be collaborating with two talented members who are also actively engaged in the LGBTQ community.

What is the SCOE Foundation ? And what’s the relationship with Bridging Worlds ? 

SCOE Foundation stands for Spiritual Court of Equity Foundation,

It is an organization that upholds a gateway of spiritual ethics and truth to then support and facilitate the redistribution of land for projects and living structures that work in true alignment with Earth Mother, the Rights Of Nature and Universal Love. 

The SCOE foundation will facilitate alliances between the Earth and those communities who's projects and visions set a foundation for ancient and balanced living practices in true relationship with the Earth, relationships that support the earth, educate the people, enliven and enrapture all sentient beings through visionary art, music, plant medicines, permaculture, ecology and sustainable systems of living being, ascending and dying. 

Indeed, Bridging Worlds believes in the return of a Golden Age and is here to support The Event that will bring us back home, to ourselves. Bridging Wolrds will now work in Partnership with The SCOE foundation to raise funds, create partnerships and also Bridge communities who are driving the movement home in alignment with the true Rights of Nature. Bridging Worlds will be raising funds for the foundation through the sales of it’s garments.

 

INVEST IN BRINGING CLOTHING TO THE HOLISTIC / HEALING DEPARTMENT

The main function of clothing today

The primary use of clothing is to cover our bodies and to afford a protection from heat and cold. They have derived into a use to please the eye and express a lot about one’s status, personality and occupation.  

Bridging Worlds’ end goal is to take clothing to a holistic level by infusing crystal into it’s fabric. But we need your help.

This is probably Bridging Worlds most unique and exciting aspect.

There exists a process that allows this alchemy to take place. For now, it is mostly used in Nano engineering for other purposes. But Bridging Worlds wants to experiment this for it’s own goal of bringing another form of healing to the people.

Our experimentation is based on the knowledge gathered around the healing properties of crystals. Indeed, for thousands of years, ancient civilizations have utilized the power of crystals to release mental, physical and spiritual blockages, thus facilitating the free flow throughout the body. On a cellular level, our bodies are made up of mineral silicon-dioxide. Because of this, we are naturally receptive to the vibrations of crystals as they transmit, reflect, store light and receive energy. So, when crystals are placed directly on our body, they have a powerful vibratory effect that surges from the crystal to you. And according to the law of physics, thoughts direct energy and energy follows thought.

We want our crystal energy garments to serve as a tool to help the thoughts of your consciousness connect with your body. 

This is an opportunity for you to invest in an exciting new venture, a way of wearing that will uplift and empower both the wearer and maker. Join us on this venture. 

 

MORE DETAILS ON THE SOCIAL ENTERPRISE

How is Bridging Worlds setup ? 

Bridging Worlds is a social enterprise that is setup as an online business and that will start it’s  production in Thailand.

Who is Bridging Worlds target audience ?

Bridging Worlds' target audience is :

- The 20 to 45 years old men, women and non binary.

- People who identify with the New Age / Vegan / Conscious Movement

- People with hobbies and passions for spiritual gatherings and festivals, eco travels, visionary art, holistic and alternative healing.

- People politically engaged in human and animal rights,  in community projects and  environmental causes.

What is Bridging Worlds marketing strategy? 

Bridging Worlds will sell mostly online (80%) through our website : www.oneearthonetribe.org  Facebook and Instagram.  Bridging Worlds will expand it’s market with :

- Sales in markets and in festivals. Mostly in Australia where the most of our community resides and where the economy is strong. 

- Wholesale in key places known within the ‘conscious community’ as being spiritual destinations : Koh Phangan in Thailand, Ubud in Bali, San Marcos in Guatemala, etc

- Wholesale in America in States like Colorado, California and Oregon where hemp is very popular and the economy quite strong due to the legalization of marijuana. 

At what stage is Bridging Worlds ? 

Bridging Worlds is at a stage between the prototype and production phase. We have a first prototype and first tribal design.

Part of the funding will go to finish this prototype with the embroidery and in creating the rest of our collection to start the production. More details below.

What has been done these past 3 months and what’s still unfolding at the moment ?

- We have sourced the fabrics and accessories at the local market.

- We have our first clothing prototype done and our first tribal design..

- We have the designs for the next 4 garments. And one extra tribal design about to come in from our tattoo artist, Elu.

- We have the association who is taking on the production under their name for legal purposes.

- We have the working space to start the production, based outside of Chiang Mai.

- We have a website setup as a landing page, featuring a number of things including an online shop : www.oneearthonetribe.org

- We have Facebook pages and Instragram accounts setup and we are currently creating and programming relevant and interesting content. 

Who composes the team and what are their values ?

We have an amazing and talented team in place that covers most of the key positions : 

* Robert is our online architect.  He has built the website and is heading the department of marketing. He has been doing this for a few years now. He is truly a passionate, always seeking for new ways of operating and building authentic relationship with his clients. 

* Jesse designed our first prototype. Jesse is from South Africa and now lives in Chiang Mai, Thailand. He is starting his own brand of clothing from upcycled fabric. His style is designed to fit those who identify as gender fluid. This is a cause dear to him. 

* Aoth is our pattern maker. He is Thai and well spoken in English. He has taught himself the skills of pattern making from his passion for Ladyboy Cabaret Shows in which he is very much involved. He is an artist and a creative that knows how to think ‘outside of the box’ and who is very much appreciated by his community. 

* Lrun is the the main qualified tailor who will also be training the rest of the team to our standards. She knows how to handweave hemp and dye naturally and has worked with a couple of international clothing companies. She has learned this knowledge from her mother and is now passing this knowledge onto her daughter.  

* Jeab is our main agent of liaison. Born in Bangkok, she grew up in Central Africa and Germany, This allows Jeab to have have an understanding of both western and eastern ways. She genuinely is passionate in showing support to anyone in need and in building community. Her fluency in English and Thai have also proven to be a huge asset to the smooth running of our project. 

* Suzette is our operational manager in charge of quality control and exportation. She is Australian and has been living in Thailand since 2012. She has a company that provides ethically handmade products to multiple companies around the world. She has a passion for creating environmentally friendly products and making companies aware of where their products are coming from.

* Polia is the first tattoo artist with whom we started collaborating. Part of her work is channeling cosmic portals, containers of energetic codes that she weaves in her creations. Over the last 4 years, she's been sharing her work at a larger scale within the conscious community of The Rainbow Serpent Festival; creating interactive installations, spaces for people to step into other worlds.

 

 

ABOUT THE CROWDFUNDING

How much funds are we raising ? And what will the funds be used for ? 

We are raising $ 20 000. This will be used accordingly :

- $500 to get the last patterns and prototypes done and finish our first collection called Samsara.

- $500 to experiment infusing crystals in fabrics.

- $800 to pay for the design of our logo.

- $700 to pay for the trademarks : business name and logo.

- $3,000 to help us start with our online marketing strategy including Facebook ads.

- $1,500 to purchase a camera that will allow us to put online our own / high quality photos and showcase our clothing line. 

- $1,000 to hire the services of a branding expert. 

- $200 to finish paying off the service of the videographer who created the promo video

- $6,500 to purchase the bus that will transport our products from festival to festival in Australia.

- $4,000 to pay for the material and labor to build our market stall.

- $1,000 to pay upfront the first 3 festivals in Australia

- $500 to pay for the Thai visas

What is the main risk and challenge that Bridging Worlds could encounter ?

The main challenge that I see for Bridging Worlds today, is keeping up with time frames and delays in the production and exportation. It’s true : Thailand has really a timing of its own. It is very much cultural and quite widely spread in the mentalities. Thai people have a popular saying describing this, which is ‘Sabai Sabai’ meaning : Relax, there’s no need to rush.

The best way that I’ve found to overcome this challenge was to adopt a business model that is in alignment with the slow fashion industry. In this scenario, it is understood that the production is based on schedules that are more flexible. However, we will have at least 3 people on the mission of monitoring the most important deadlines. 

The main risk for Bridging Worlds, is to see new laws  voted by Thai government that would be this enterprise more difficult . We are operating legally in Thailand, in partnership with an association who comes in support to the hill tribe people by providing them with warm clothes for winter. This association has expanded their social and humanitarian mission by incorporating our production in their mission. 

Also, the best way that I’ve found to overcome this risk, is by keeping our production small in Thailand (with 4 tailors max) and expanding our production in Nepal where the culture and use of hemp is worldly known. Furthermore, Nepali people are also looking for opportunities to rebuild wealth and community after the 2015 Earthquake. 

 

IN CONCLUSION

A LAST CONFESSION 

Before coming to the conclusion, I want to share with you that I feel very happy, proud, excited, humbled and in aw by the birthing and evolution of Bridging Worlds, One Earth One Tribe and SCOE Foundation. 

Looking back at the work that has been accomplished in less than three months, it’s quite impressive and really incredible ! Support came in very early, with for example, $1,500 of financial aid that came in before any prototype was  designed. Today, the community supporting these projects have spread to four continents. 

I can only link this phenomenon to the facts that these projects are coherent with an offer that is in alignment with our time and need for change. Also, these projects come from a place of Love. They all are about ‘giving back’ : giving back to the people, giving back to Mother Earth. I believe that these projects speak to peoples’ souls like it does to mine. 

Of course, there is space for progress and betterment. But this is where we are at today. I have trust in these projects like I have faith in us. We will succeed.  

ALL KIND OF HELP WILL BE APPRECIATED INCLUDING TECH SUPPORT AND DONATION OF MATERIAL

Yes, we want to raise $20,000 and we are very grateful for your contributions. Every dollar is important to us. THANK YOU. 

At the same, we invite everyone to join us on Facebook and Insragram to follow our progress. Sharing our work is also a great way to show your support.

Finally, we would deeply appreciate any kind technical support, especially for our online presence : Branding, Marketing, …

And material donations like a 2nd hand camera or laptops or crystals wou!d also be amazing !

THANK YOU !!!!!
