story:
About this project:

Since our Grand Opening, we have participated in numerous Charity Fund Raiser and Events. We have raised funds on the Golf Course for "Future Collegiate Softball Athletes Fund", and the "Go Red" campaign for the "Woman's Cancer Fund". Upcoming events include "Fallen and Wounded Soldiers" Fund Raiser. And more to follow. We believe in giving back!


Hole In One Jerky  uses all natural ingredients and 100% whole sliced "London Broil", the tender STEAK jerky you have been craving - no added preservatives!!!

We marinade our jerky for 48 hours and then into the dehydrator for 5 to 7 hours. Cool then we package. Everything done by hand!!!

Our Shop

What We Need & What You Get

Spending Summary:

* Meat - we use only London Broil in our Jerky (only get 1/2 product to every pound)

* Marinade & spices - to make our Jerky super yummy!!!

* Product packaging & printing of labels

* Display racks for our breweries and golf courses

* Marketing/marketing/marketing

* Vendor fees for upcoming events & charity fund raisers

* License & Permits for our Jerky for Dogs (can't forget your best friend!!!)

* Dehydrators 

Other Milestone Funding Goals!!!

One of our dream dehydrators:

    Above some of our Flavors, more are tested and tried all the time. And of course our awesome pen!!! You know you want one.


                    * 3 - 3oz bags (mild, spicy, or your choice)

                    * 1 - 3 oz bag "Flavor Of The Month"

                            Shipped right to your door!!!!!

The Impact

The impact every donation makes can take our business to the next level. Whether your donation is small or large every dollar helps make our goals a reality. We Thank everyone for the support and continued support.

Risks & Challenges

We have come along way since October!!! Events, Fund Raisers and we are also in 6 local Craft Breweries. And along with all this, we of course, are having growing pains. There is so much more we want to do. More breweries we want to add to the list, do some Jerky - Beer pairing ( yeah yummy) we have just started our "Jerky of the Month Club". Unfortunately, we don't have enough dehydrators and equipment to meet the demand. That's where we need your help. We will upgrade our equipment, and be able to produce more, buy in bulk, and lower our costs. This will help us get our Jerky to you and everybody that whats the higher quality that we provide. No matter how much we grow, we will always use all natural ingredients with no added preservatives. We take pride in our product, it is a healthy protein snack good for whatever you do and easy to take along on whatever adventures you concur. Thank you for any help you can give. Please share with friends, family and everybody!!! We appreciate all your help and support!!!

Other Ways You Can Help

We understand if you can't contribute today, but you can still help!!! Please share our Campaign with friends and family. Every email, Facebook, & tweet gets us the exposure to help us meet our goals.

* Marketing/marketing/marketing 
* Vendor fees for upcoming events & charity fund raisers
* License & Permits for our Jerky for Dogs (can't forget your best friend!!!)
* Dehydrators 
Other Milestone Funding Goals!!!
One of our dream dehydrators:







These puppies start at $6000 up to $16000!!!Your generous donation Perks:





Above some of our Flavors, more are tested and tried all the time. And of course our awesome pen!!! You know you want one.



                                 Jerky Of The Month Club


                * 3 - 3oz bags (mild, spicy, or your choice) 
                * 1 - 3 oz bag "Flavor Of The Month"
                        Shipped right to your door!!!!!
   The ImpactThe impact every donation makes can take our business to the next level. Whether your donation is small or large every dollar helps make our goals a reality. We Thank everyone for the support and continued support.
  Risks & Challenges  We have come along way since October!!! Events, Fund Raisers and we are 
also in 6 local Craft Breweries. And along with all this, we of course, 
are having growing pains. There is so much more we want to do. More 
breweries we want to add to the list, do some Jerky - Beer pairing ( 
yeah yummy) we have just started our "Jerky of the Month Club".  
Unfortunately, we don't have enough dehydrators and equipment to meet 
the demand. That's where we need your help. We will upgrade our 
equipment, and be able to produce more, buy in bulk, and lower our 
costs. This will help us get our Jerky to you and everybody that whats 
the higher quality that we provide. No matter how much we grow, we will 
always use all natural ingredients with no added preservatives. We take 
pride in our product, it is a healthy protein snack good for whatever 
you do and easy to take along on whatever adventures you concur. Thank 
you for any help you can give. Please share with friends, family and 
everybody!!! We appreciate all your help and support!!!
 
   Other Ways You Can HelpWe understand if you can't contribute today, but you can still help!!! Please share our Campaign with friends and family. Every email, Facebook, & tweet gets us the exposure to help us meet our goals.

story:
"This little jewelry shop proves good things come in small packages." 
- Midwest Living

"Sloan+Themis has really inspired me to be more creative with how I wear jewelry and how I express myself" - Toni E., MO

"What I love about the style of Sloan+Themis is that it is elegant yet distinct."
- Rayme H., MO

"Seriously pretty and all handmade." - Dani T., GA

"I love it because it is so unique and delicate yet extremely durable. I'm constantly banging it around on conference tables during meetings. It's the perfect bracelet for a woman like me who is always on the move." - Casey C., MO

" I have very narrow wrists so I ordered the smaller bracelet size and it fits perfectly. Looks as cool and vintage in person as it does in the pics." - Gipsy, IA



When we started three years ago, we quickly noticed that our jewelry found a home with hard-working professional women. Why might you ask? Our customers demand both luxury and practicality, and that's exactly what we deliver. From our tiny shop, we have gained traction locally and are quickly gaining popularity in the Southeast US. Now we need your help to let all strong successful women nationwide experience jewelry that will enrich and keep up with their busy lives.


Materials

Jewelry that feels incredible to wear is the jewelry you'll never want to take off. That’s why we only use natural gemstones, the highest quality freshwater pearls, and sterling silver.

Craftsmanship
We are proud to share in the tradition of American craftsmanship. Each of our pieces are handcrafted with the utmost attention to detail in our workshop on the banks of the Mississippi River. 

Luxury
 We know you've worked hard and that’s why we want our jewelry to be something you can cherish. You deserve this luxury!

Practicality
Not only do we design for beauty, but for functionality and durability as well. Our jewelry is constructed for every occasion for any woman on-the-go.

Durability... We Guarantee it
 All of our pieces are designed to be worn each day and be passed down to the next generation of extraordinary women. That means we guarantee each piece for life.


Successful, confident women come in all shapes, sizes, backgrounds and professions. Each day we are inspired by our customers, who lead incredibly busy lives as career women, mothers, daughters, sisters, wives, girlfriends, best friends, volunteers and leaders in their community. 
This is why we are committed to showing real women role-models from our customer base instead of fashion models. Not only does this help promote a positive image of what a confident woman is, it inspires other customers to live their lives to the fullest.



MidwestLiving.com

American Express OPEN Forum

Working Mother

Missouri Life

Bourbon & Boots

Made in USA Challenge

The Southern C

Flourish Magazine For Women

The Southeast Missourian


Over the past three and half years we have grown from our tiny storefront on a Main Street to a fast growing brand throughout the South. We'd like to take our new collection to women nationwide. Now we need your help. 

Producing the Collection

We are proud to be a part of the tradition of American-craftsmanship. As our popularity grows we need to ramp-up to support larger volume orders internally as well as work with other American made manufacturers to create our unique designs. Your contribution will help us expand our internal and external production capability.

Taking the Show on the Road

The best way to sell a collection is to hit the road and sell it! Your contribution will help us as we book trunk shows in key markets and recruit bloggers, style editors, style mavens and stylists to help bring our brand to successful women nationwide.








.

Getting the word out about the campaign is just as important as the funds we raise. Even if you feel you cannot contribute financially, you can still help this campaign succeed: 

  1. Share our link, http://igg.me/at/sloanthemis, on Facebook, Twitter, and Google+.
  2. Forward this email on to anyone who might be interested. 
  3. Forward this information to any magazines, writers, or bloggers who cover fashion, small businesses or finance. 
  4. Add Sloan+Themis jewelry to your Christmas or Hanukkah list!
  5. Good old-fashioned word of mouth! 


Here are some questions you might be asking yourself...


Q: How will the money I give be spent?

A: If we make our goal, 60% of our funds we raise will go to production upgrades including making your item. 40% will go to trunk show set-up costs and marketing in major markets.

Q: When will my perks ship?

A: Since our production is done at our Cape Girardeau, MO atelier, fulfillment should go quickly. The campaign will end around 11/13/2015. So your order should no later than 12/21/2015.   We will be sending you tracking information when your order ships so you can track your package as it makes it's way to you. Our team is vigilant about timely shipping. If you experience an issue with delivery, please email us at admin@sloanandthemis.com. We will contact you within 24 hours after receiving your request. 

Q: What size of bracelets do you have available? How can I request the right size?

A: We stock two sizes 7.5" and 8.0", other sizes are available on request. Once you have made your purchase, we will email you to ask what sizing you would like. To find your size, take a piece of string and wrap snugly (but not tightly around your wrist). Pinch were the end the string meets the rest of it. Then take a ruler and measure the distance between the end of the string and the pinched part. Now add an inch to that measurement to get your bracelet size. For example it your wrist is 6.75" your bracelet size will between 7.75" and 8.0". So you will order the 8.0". 

Q: What if I need a different size?

A: We guarantee sizing. All you will need to do is send it back, and we will size it up or down based on your needs. Please email us at admin@sloanandthemis.com to start this process.

Q:  What if I want to exchange my item for something else?

A: Before the campaign ends if you would like to swap your items, we will help you work with the Indiegogo customer service team to make the exchange. After the campaign has ended, please email us at admin@sloanandthemis.com to start this process. The value of your exchange is based on the amount of your Indiegogo contribution, not the regular retail price of the item. If your exchange is due to an item that is damaged during shipping, please let us know in your email.

Q: Will the pricing and products you are offering for this campaign be available in your shop or on your online store?

A: The pricing for this campaign is exclusive to Indiegogo. Because what you select is made to order based on the number of orders we have, it makes our purchasing much more efficient, and we can pass the savings on to you as we raise money. As for products, many of them can be found both in our shop and on our website. If the product is noted as "Exclusive for Indiegogo Supporters", then Indiegogo is the only place you can get it.

Q: I would love to carry your products in my boutique or on my website. Do you offer wholesale pricing?

A: Yes, we do. If you are interested in carrying Sloan+Themis in your boutique or website, please email us at info@sloanandthemis.com. We work with each potential partner to find the right mix of product for their customer base. As with any wholesale arrangement, we have minimums and payment options.

Q: I am a journalist, business writer, style editor, blogger... that would love to feature Sloan+Themis. How can I schedule an interview?

A: We loved to talk with you too! Please contact us at info@sloanandthemis.com. Claire, our founder, or Holly, our head of marketing will schedule an interview right away.

Q: Why do an Indiegogo campaign?

A: There are a ton of reasons. We'll share with you our one of our favorites. Indiegogo was actually started by a woman to fund creative projects (like those in our industry) that were being passed over by traditional investors. Did you know that women-lead campaigns on Indiegogo are 60% more likely to make or exceed their goal than similar ones lead by men? As a brand that celebrates successful women, we are ecstatic to be apart of Indiegogo!

Q: I would like Sloan+Themis to purchase my company's products and services. How can I contact you? 

A: In recent weeks we have been overwhelmed with businesses contacting us about using their offerings. Due to the small size of our company, we cannot support numerous requests from businesses and individuals pitching products and services at this time. Out of respect for our supporters and in accordance with Indiegogo's policies, we ask that you not post any sales-related comments to our Indiegogo campaign. 

Q: I am an angel investor or work for a VC firm and would like to find out more information. How can I contact you?

A: We look forward to hearing from you. Please reach out to us at info@sloanandthemis.com. 

Q: I would like to host a Sloan+Themis trunk show. How can I schedule one? 

A: We are currently taking requests for trunk shows for 2016 in markets in the Southeastern US. We speak individually with each hostess to determine when and if a show would work for them. To schedule a time to talk, please reach out to us at info@sloanandthemis.com.

story:
Dear contributors, 

We are an internationally operating couture label, established in 2006 by Dutch

designer Ingeborg Steenhorst. This October we are going to launch an unique fashion and music production called 'Back To Roots'. This production will feature our new Men & Women couture fashion line for 2016, accompanied by a music soundtrack. Our goal is to get funding to create the new couture collection and present it through a multi disciplined fashion show with live music, dance and mesmerizing visuals. 

 We want to make the world a better looking, enjoyable and healthier place by creating beautiful fashion, great music and stopping deforestation by supporting a good cause: The Stand for Trees organization!


Who are we?
We are a Dutch couture label operating from our own atelier/workshop in 's-Hertogenbosch. Ingeborg Steenhorst Couture is hand-dyed, hand painted, screen printed, feathered, elegantly tailored and richly decorated,all intended to turn the wearer into a rocking star!  Our main designer and label founder Ingeborg Steenhorst, is a well known name in the world of custom made couture outfits and accessories. Her unique style and eye for detail has made her become most successful in the fields of couture clothing, headpieces and fashion accessories, to even bespoke couture bridal designs. Her stunning creations are worn by female politicians, celebrities and international rock stars such as Floor Jansen (Nightwish), Cristina Scabbia (Lacuna Coil), Simone Simons (Epica), Dianne van Giersbergen (Xandria) and many others!



Simone Simons (left) and Floor Jansen (right) in their custom designed stage outfits by Ingeborg Steenhorst. Pictures: Tim Tronckoe (left), Richard Stark (right)

Back to Roots
With Back to Roots we are going to present our new 2016 Men & Women couture line and music soundtrack through a multidisciplinary fashion show. Beautiful catwalk models will be supported by live music and dance, all framed by state of the art video visuals. The soundtrack will be exclusively composed for Back to Roots by Basecamp Audio, under musical direction of Ivo van Dijk (Karmaflow 'the world's first rock opera videogame & Equilibrio 'the rock opera'), with composers Sophie Ansems and Colin van der Lei. The entire soundtrack will be performed live by conductor/drummer Ivo van Dijk, guitarist Rob Willemse (Cirrha Niva), bass guitarist Daniël Huijben (11th Hour, ex-Cirrha Niva), Lisette van den Berg (Scarlet Stories, Karmaflow, Epic Rock Choir), Monique Op Heij (Seventh Sin), Laura Guldemond ( Generation Lost, Epic Rock Choir) and violin player Sophie Ansems (Karmaflow). The video visuals supporting the fashion show will feature graphics and photo art created by Ingeborg Steenhorst. The video production will be co-produced by Tom de Wit of the Imagineering Suite.

By supporting us, you're not only helping us to realize our goals, you are also making the world a better place by saving trees!

The Concept
The 'Back to Roots' concept is mainly based on two things; as a couture label that partially operates in the alternative music scene, the new couture line of designer Ingeborg Steenhorst will be inspired by the attitude and styling expressions from iconic bands in the heavy music scene over the past decades. By blending in alternative subculture with exclusive couture designs, she is literally going back to her roots! The other reason for chosen this concept title, is because designer Ingeborg is very committed to approaching fashion in a sustainable way. This shows in often using reused antique fabrics and garments, laces, beads and unique embroideries. 

Sustainable Couture Fashion and Stand for Trees
The entire couture collection will be hand-sewn at the company’s own atelier in 's-Hertogenbosch. This minimizes the production of waste and excess materials, while ensuring good and controlled working conditions. We have decided to take this sustainable approach one step further, by supporting the Stand For Trees organization!

A little glimpse of our atelier in 's-Hertogenbosch


Stand for Trees
The Stand For Trees  Organization is an innovative  campaign that enables individuals to take real action to stop forest loss: the number one cause of species extinction and second-leading cause of CO2 emissions globally. To stop this trend, Stand For Trees has developed the REDD+ program to 'reduce emissions from deforestation and forest degradation'. This model allows consumers to buy Stand For Trees Certificates that protect a specific piece of endangered forest. For every 10 dollar that you help us raise for the Stand for Trees, we are able to purchase 1 certificate. Every certificate will prevent a tonne of CO2 from being released into the atmosphere. For more information regarding Stand For Trees, please have a look at standfortrees.org


The Fashion Show
We will present the new couture collection with a multidisciplined fashion show   in music hall De Effenaar in Eindhoven on the 17th of October. The show will be the special opening act of FemMe Event. A two-day festival paying a tribute to women in rock & metal on and off of stage, headlined by Lacuna Coil and Therion.  Please note that the fashion show is part of this festival for which only day-tickets are available. If you are interested in only visiting the fashion show, you can get a refund on your day-ticket if you leave the venue within 30 minutes after the fashion show.  Tickets for FemME can be purchased online through the official Effenaar website.


The show contain live music, dancers and couture fashion!


Why help?
Not only do we want to make the world a prettier place, we also want it to become a healthier place where we, you and our children can enjoy unique fashion and great music in a beautiful, better world! Our goal is to raise enough money to create and  present our new collection in an amazing way with a multi disciplined fashion show.  However, just asking support for our project alone doesn't feel right. By supporting us, you are not just becoming a part of our fashion design & art project, in fact you are also helping us to prevent deforestation of rain forests.  We will use a part of the donated fundings to buy Stand For Trees Certificates and help to  stop deforestation and safe rainforest.


What do we need?
Creating a collection and organizing a multidisciplinary fashion show unfortunately doesn't come cheap.
This is a little overview of what we can do with your support;
- Buy fabrics and materials to create the collection
- Pay the models, musicians and dancers a honest fee
- Have the show filmed and have an after movie created for you to enjoy
- Buy Stand For Trees certificates and safe rainforest

The following official after movie of the Ingeborg Steenhorst fashion show 2015 'Adrenaline' gives you an impression of what we can do with your support. 




Perks (what you get for donating)

To get an overview on what we have to offer in exchange for your donation, check the perk menu on the right. Every perk has a clear description in which we've mentioned how much of your donation will go to Stand for Trees.

Below we have highlighted the official 'Back to Roots' merchandise perks, as well as some very exclusive and one-of-a-kind couture perks; 



Basic Donation 

For a small donation of only € 2 you will get your name in our fashion show! At the end of the show we will showcase all of our funders on a big screen. *€0.50 cents will be donated to Stand for Trees

_____________________________________________________________________________

Photo card set
Exclusive full color photo card set, consisting of a 'Back to Roots' photocard + 3 fashion photo cards showing beautiful fashion designs and photography by Ingeborg Steenhorst. 

__________________________________________________________________________

Sustainable 'Back to Roots' T-shirt merchandise

One of our perks are these exclusive 'Back to Roots t-shirts. These t-shirts are made of a very environmental friendly material called Tencel. Tencel is a natural, fiber made with wood pulp from sustainable tree farms. Tencel textiles are created through the use of Nano-technology in an award-winning closed-loop process that recovers or decomposes all solvents and emissions. Beautiful and sustainable!

The following models & sizes are available for purchase: 

BtR  Women's  T-Shirt
Size:  XS-S (34-36) / M-L (38-40) /  L-XL  (42-44)

BtR Men's T-Shirt
Size: S / M / L / XL / 2XL

Please send an e-mail to  jesper.emmen@ingeborgsteenhorst.com to specify which model and size you would like to get for your donation. Important: Refer to your pledge ID.

__________________________________________________________________________

Exclusive couture jeans chain
One of a kind, custom made jeans chain by Ingeborg Steenhorst. This exclusive, unisex accessory, made of stainless steel will add some serious attitude to your style!


__________________________________________________________________________

Pair of studded wristbands
A pair of handmade, one of a kind mens wristbands by Ingeborg Steenhorst made from 100% cotton, artificial leather and decorated with bronze studs and buttons. 


__________________________________________________________________________

Couture fascinator hat
Exclusive one of a kind feather fascinator hat from the Ingeborg Steenhorst couture collection. A true show stopper! 

__________________________________________________________________________

Dark brown coated shirt

Fitted shirt, hand painted by the designer with sustainable 'wet look' coating and decorated with metal bronze skull studs. The shirt has an  artificial leather decoration on the right shoulder, containing bronze metal buttons.


__________________________________________________________________________

Denim Flower Jacket

This one of a kind denim jacket has been hand painted by the designer using an antique golden, sustainable ink coating. The jacket is decorated with metal bronze skull studs and luxurious round and pyramid studs. The garment contains screen printed 'flower' photo-artwork by Ingeborg Steenhorst.

__________________________________________________________________________

'The Drip' Dress
One of a kind couture dress, hand painted by Ingeborg Steenhorst with a drip pattern of black latex rubber. The garment is made from copper colored metallic stretch jersey with sleeves from black stretch leather look.

__________________________________________________________________________

Mens vest jacket 'Epic'
This exclusive, one of a kind mens couture vest jacket is based on the stage outfit collection Ingeborg made for Epica's 'the Requiem of the Indifferent' tour. The hand painted ink coating, screen prints an metal studs make this piece a true collectors item for everybody who loves epic(a) fashion!

__________________________________________________________________________

Custom made couture piece
Get your own custom designer couture outfit from Ingeborg Steenhorst Couture together with framed designer sketch! As a top of the bill perk we offer 1 custom made couture outfit of your choice (for example a wedding dress or costume!) for a one-time-only fixed price. So grab this chance if you would like to wear a personal and exclusive custom designed outfit by Ingeborg Steenhorst couture!


__________________________________________________________________________

Sharing is caring!
If you would like to support us even more, we kindly request you to share our crowdfunding campaign with the people around you. Share our webpage, talk to your friends about us, write about us in your social media or simply like our Facebook or Instagram page. Please use the special indiegogo share tools and get the word out there. Thank you!! 

No paypal or creditcard? No problem!
If you would like to support us without using a creditcard or paypal account, it is possible to do so by bank transfer. Please inform us about what perk you would like to purchase, by sending an email to jesper.emmen@ingeborsteenhorst.com. Once your donation has been received, we will update you about the status of your order. Our bank details are located at the bottom of this message. 

Dutch Contributors (only in Dutch)
Aangezien het via indiegogo.com enkel mogelijk is om met Paypal of Creditcard te betalen, hebben we besloten ook donaties per bankoverschrijving te accepteren. Als u ons op deze wijze wilt helpen, dan kunt u kiezen uit de 'perks' die worden aangeboden via dit crowdfunding platform. Het enige wat u hoeft te doen is ons te informeren welke perk u heeft gekozen. U wordt verzocht uw bestelling en adresgegevens te mailen naar jesper.emmen@ingeborgsteenhorst.com. Er zal dan zsm contact met u opgenomen worden. 

Bank account Ingeborg Steenhorst Couture
I.E.A Ingeborg Steenhorst
IBAN code: NL05INGB0004268027
BIC code: INGBNL2A



Thank you for your support! We will keep you updated with all developments regarding 'Back to Roots' and we hope to see you soon at one of our fashion shows!

Ingeborg & Jesper

Ingeborg Steenhorst (Creative Director / Designer) and Jesper Emmen (Managing Director) Picture by Tim Tronckoe
story_txt:
Dear contributors, We are an internationally operating couture label, established in 2006 by Dutch designer Ingeborg Steenhorst. This October we are going to launch an unique fashion and music production called 'Back To Roots'. This production will feature our new Men & Women couture fashion line for 2016, accompanied by a music soundtrack. Our goal is to get funding to create the new couture collection and present it through a multi disciplined fashion show with live music, dance and mesmerizing visuals.   We want to make the world a better looking, enjoyable and healthier place by creating beautiful fashion, great music and stopping deforestation by supporting a good cause: The Stand for Trees organization! 
Who are we?We are a Dutch couture label operating from our own atelier/workshop in 's-Hertogenbosch.  Ingeborg Steenhorst Couture is hand-dyed, hand painted, screen printed, 
feathered, elegantly tailored and richly decorated,all intended to turn the 
wearer into a rocking star!  Our main designer and label founder Ingeborg Steenhorst, is a well known name in the world of custom made couture outfits and accessories. Her unique style and eye for detail has made her become most successful in the fields of couture clothing, headpieces and fashion accessories, to even bespoke couture bridal designs. Her stunning creations are worn by female politicians, celebrities and international rock stars such as Floor Jansen  (Nightwish), Cristina Scabbia (Lacuna Coil), Simone Simons (Epica), Dianne van Giersbergen (Xandria) and many others!

Simone Simons (left) and Floor Jansen (right) in their custom designed stage outfits by Ingeborg Steenhorst. Pictures: Tim Tronckoe (left), Richard Stark (right)


Back to RootsWith Back to Roots we are going to present our new 2016 Men & Women couture line and music soundtrack through a multidisciplinary fashion show. Beautiful catwalk models will be supported by live music and dance, all framed by state of the art video visuals. The soundtrack will be exclusively composed for Back to Roots by Basecamp Audio, under musical direction of Ivo van Dijk (Karmaflow 'the world's first rock opera videogame & Equilibrio 'the rock opera'), with composers Sophie Ansems and Colin van der Lei. The entire soundtrack will be performed live by conductor/drummer Ivo van Dijk, guitarist Rob Willemse (Cirrha Niva), bass guitarist Daniël Huijben (11th Hour, ex-Cirrha Niva), Lisette van den Berg (Scarlet Stories, Karmaflow, Epic Rock Choir), Monique Op Heij (Seventh Sin), Laura Guldemond ( Generation Lost, Epic Rock Choir) and violin player Sophie Ansems (Karmaflow). The video visuals supporting the fashion show will feature graphics and photo art created by Ingeborg Steenhorst. The video production will be co-produced by Tom de Wit of the Imagineering Suite. 



By supporting us, you're not only helping us to realize our goals, you are also making the world a better place by saving trees!



The ConceptThe 'Back to Roots' concept is mainly based on two things; as a couture label that partially operates in the alternative music scene, the new couture line of designer Ingeborg Steenhorst will be inspired by the attitude and styling expressions from iconic bands in the heavy music scene over the past decades. By blending in alternative subculture with exclusive couture designs, she is literally going back to her roots! The other reason for chosen this concept title, is because designer Ingeborg is very committed to approaching fashion in a sustainable way. This shows in often using reused antique fabrics and garments, laces, beads and unique embroideries. 
Sustainable Couture Fashion and Stand for TreesThe entire couture collection will be hand-sewn at the company’s own atelier in 's-Hertogenbosch. This minimizes the production of waste and excess materials, while ensuring good and controlled working conditions. We have decided to take this sustainable approach one step further, by supporting the Stand For Trees organization!

A little glimpse of our atelier in 's-HertogenboschStand for TreesThe Stand For Trees  Organization is an innovative
 campaign that enables individuals to take real action to stop forest loss: the number one cause of
species extinction and second-leading cause of CO2 emissions globally. To stop
this trend, Stand For Trees has developed the REDD+ program to
'reduce emissions from deforestation and forest degradation'. This model allows
consumers to buy Stand For Trees Certificates that protect a specific piece of endangered forest. For every 10 dollar that you help us raise for the Stand for
Trees, we are able to purchase 1 certificate. Every certificate
will prevent
a tonne of CO2 from being released into the atmosphere. For more
information regarding Stand For Trees, please have a look at standfortrees.org


The Fashion Show We will present the new couture collection with a multidisciplined fashion show   in music hall De Effenaar in Eindhoven on the 17th of October. The show will be the special opening act of FemMe Event. A two-day festival paying a tribute to women in rock & metal on and off of stage, headlined by Lacuna Coil and Therion.  Please note that the fashion show is part of this festival for which only day-tickets are available. If you are interested in only visiting the fashion show, you can get a refund on your day-ticket if you leave the venue within 30 minutes after the fashion show.  Tickets for FemME can be purchased online through the official Effenaar website.The show contain live music, dancers and couture fashion!






Why help?Not only do we want to
make the world a prettier place, we also want it to become a healthier place
where we, you and our children can enjoy unique fashion and great music in a
beautiful, better world! Our goal is to raise enough money to create and  present our  new collection in an amazing way with a multi disciplined fashion show.  However, just asking support for our project alone
doesn't feel right. By supporting us, you are not just becoming a part of our
fashion design & art project, in fact you are also helping us to prevent deforestation of rain forests.  We will use a part of the donated fundings to buy Stand For Trees Certificates and help to  stop deforestation and safe rainforest. 

What do we need?Creating a collection and organizing a multidisciplinary fashion show unfortunately doesn't come cheap. This is a little overview of what we can do with your support;- Buy fabrics and materials to create the collection- Pay the models, musicians and dancers a honest fee- Have the show filmed and have an after movie created for you to enjoy- Buy Stand For Trees certificates and safe rainforestThe following official after movie of the Ingeborg Steenhorst fashion show 2015 'Adrenaline' gives you an impression of what we can do with your support.  

Perks (what you get for donating)

To get an overview on what we have to offer in exchange for your donation, check the perk menu on the right. Every perk has a clear description in which we've mentioned how much of your donation will go to Stand for Trees. 
Below we have highlighted the official  'Back to Roots' merchandise perks, as well as some very exclusive and one-of-a-kind couture perks; 

Basic Donation 


      
  For a small donation of only € 2 you will get your name in our fashion show! At the end of the show we will showcase all of our funders on a big screen. 
*€0.50 cents will be donated to Stand for Trees_____________________________________________________________________________
Photo card setExclusive 
full color photo card set, consisting of a 'Back to Roots' photocard + 3 fashion photo 
cards showing beautiful fashion designs and photography by Ingeborg Steenhorst. 

__________________________________________________________________________
Sustainable 'Back to Roots' T-shirt merchandise
One 
of our perks are these exclusive 'Back to Roots t-shirts. These
t-shirts are made of a very environmental friendly material called 
Tencel.
Tencel is a natural, fiber made with wood pulp from sustainable tree 
farms. Tencel textiles are created through the use of Nano-technology in
 an award-winning closed-loop process that
recovers or decomposes all solvents and emissions. Beautiful and 
sustainable!


The following models & sizes
are available for purchase: 

BtR  Women's  T-Shirt
Size:  XS-S (34-36) / M-L (38-40) /  L-XL  (42-44)
BtR Men's T-Shirt
Size: S / M / L / XL / 2XLPlease send an e-mail to  jesper.emmen@ingeborgsteenhorst.com to specify which model and size you would like to get for your donation. Important: Refer to your pledge ID.
__________________________________________________________________________
Exclusive couture jeans chainOne of a kind, custom made jeans chain by Ingeborg 
Steenhorst. This exclusive, unisex accessory, made of stainless steel will
 add some serious attitude to your style!

__________________________________________________________________________Pair of studded wristbandsA pair of handmade, one of a kind mens wristbands by Ingeborg Steenhorst made from 100% cotton, artificial leather and decorated with bronze studs and buttons.  
__________________________________________________________________________
Couture fascinator hatExclusive one of a kind feather fascinator hat from the Ingeborg Steenhorst couture collection. A true show stopper! 
__________________________________________________________________________Dark brown coated shirtFitted
shirt, hand painted by the designer with sustainable 'wet look' coating and decorated with metal bronze skull
studs. The shirt has an  artificial leather decoration on the right
shoulder, containing bronze metal buttons.

__________________________________________________________________________
Denim Flower Jacket This one of a kind denim jacket has 
been hand painted by the designer using an antique golden, sustainable ink coating. The jacket is decorated with metal bronze skull studs and luxurious round and pyramid studs. The garment contains screen printed 'flower' photo-artwork by Ingeborg Steenhorst.

__________________________________________________________________________'The Drip' DressOne of a kind couture dress, hand painted by Ingeborg Steenhorst with a drip pattern of black latex rubber. The garment is made from copper colored metallic stretch jersey with sleeves from black stretch leather look.
 __________________________________________________________________________Mens vest jacket 'Epic'This exclusive, one of a kind mens couture vest jacket is based on the stage outfit collection Ingeborg made for Epica's 'the Requiem of the Indifferent' tour. The hand painted ink coating, screen prints an metal studs make this piece a true collectors item for everybody who loves epic(a) fashion!
__________________________________________________________________________Custom made couture piece
Get your own custom designer couture outfit from Ingeborg Steenhorst Couture together with framed designer sketch! As a top of the bill perk we offer 1 custom made couture outfit of your choice (for example a wedding dress or costume!) for a one-time-only fixed price. So grab this chance if you would like to wear a personal and exclusive custom designed outfit by Ingeborg Steenhorst couture! 
__________________________________________________________________________Sharing is caring! If you would like to support us even more,
 we kindly request you to share our crowdfunding campaign with the 
people around you. Share our webpage, talk to your friends about us, 
write about us in your social media or simply like our Facebook or 
Instagram page. Please use the special indiegogo share tools and get the
 word out there. Thank you!!  No paypal or creditcard? No problem!If you would like to support us without using a creditcard or paypal account, it is possible to do so by bank transfer. Please inform us about what perk you would like to purchase, by sending an email to jesper.emmen@ingeborsteenhorst.com. Once your donation has been received, we will update you about the status of your order. Our bank details are located at the bottom of this message. Dutch Contributors (only in Dutch)Aangezien het via indiegogo.com enkel mogelijk is om met Paypal of Creditcard te betalen, hebben we besloten ook donaties per bankoverschrijving te accepteren. Als u ons op deze wijze wilt helpen, dan kunt u kiezen uit de 'perks' die worden aangeboden via dit crowdfunding platform. Het enige wat u hoeft te doen is ons te informeren welke perk u heeft gekozen. U wordt verzocht uw bestelling en adresgegevens te mailen naar jesper.emmen@ingeborgsteenhorst.com. Er zal dan zsm contact met u opgenomen worden. Bank account Ingeborg Steenhorst CoutureI.E.A Ingeborg SteenhorstIBAN code: NL05INGB0004268027BIC code: INGBNL2AThank you for your support! We will keep you updated with all developments regarding 'Back to Roots' and we hope to see you soon at one of our fashion shows!Ingeborg & Jesper
   

Ingeborg Steenhorst (Creative Director / Designer) and Jesper Emmen (Managing Director) Picture by Tim Tronckoe

story:
What is Tindra Tales?

Tindra Tales is the retelling of centuries old Icelandic folktales. It is a modern take on an old idea! Remember the book came with an accompanying record to play along while you read? We're going to bring that idea into the 21st Century. 

There will be two books: one for children telling the classic stories,  and one for adults using Iceland's famous nightlife to spice things up a little! We have been collecting stories and now are ready to finalize them by incorporating interviews with Icelanders of all ages who have been asked to share their favorite folktales.

The storybook's backdrop will be stunning photographs taken in Iceland, brought to life by one of a kind illustrations allowing us mortals to see into the usually invisible Huldofolk world. A CD will be included, filled with a soundscape captured in Iceland, original music discovered while travelling the island, and narration of the story. 

The collection of the artists' various contributions to the modern folktales will provide the reader with more than just a book... it will be a multi-sensory experience able to be enjoyed over and over. 

Target Audience:

These books will be of interest to many different groups as it is part classic tale, part art book, part multimedia experience. The following is a partial list of groups that will want a copy of this book in their home, office, studio and classroom:

  • children of all ages: the CD narration option will meet the literary needs of each child, enabling him/her to grow with the book. 
  • parents
  • ammas and avis/grandmas and grandpa
  • photographers
  • artists and appreciators
  • teachers
  • historians
  • travelers
  • and so many more!

*All photographs credited to Hugh Conacher, taken on a previous trip to Iceland.

Who is Tindra Tales?

Five artists and professionals from Canada and Iceland have come together to participate in the Tindra Tales Project. 

Team members are all accomplished artists and professionals in their own disciplines and have come together, each offering their specific skilsl to the project. The Tindra Tales artists objective is to develop and produce two coffee table worthy books that will be something you want to look at, listen to and read, over and over!

Introductions:

Illustrator Disa Kauk is a graphic facilitator based out of Toronto, and has been running her successful business since 2008.

'Disa' is actually the nickname of her Icelandic great-grandmother, Herdis Petra Helgason Innes! When asked about a favourite folk or fairy tale, Disa was quick to share that she prefers more realistic tales, nothing too sanitized! The Yule Lads, an elf tale, is one of her favs. www.dscribe.ca

Photographer Hugh Conacher is also a lighting designer whose work is appreciated locally, nationally and internationally. 

Although he isn't actually connected to the island by blood, he has definitely caught the Icelandic bug having worked there in the past. Hugh's daughter said he always encouraged reading at home. When asked what was on the bookshelves as a child, she shared a memory of her father reading her the ancient Greek myth of Persephone.

Producer and Sound Coordinator Angela Chalmers lives in Winnipeg with family scattered through Manitoba's Interlake area.

In the past, Angela worked as an actor. Recently, she co-launched a documentary production company that uses audio and video to capturing family stories and tell social issue triumphs. Of Icelandic descent, Angela grew up hearing Icelandic folk tales and fell in love with them. www.aihproductions.com

Cultural Consultant Jon Gustafsson is a filmmaker who splits his time between Iceland and Canada. 

His favourite activities include aerial film and photography, especially filming erupting volcanoes! When I asked him about beloved childhood folktales, he drew a blank. I guess he didn't sit still then either - he was probably busy running around creating his own stories! www.JonGustafsson.com

Project and Writing Consultant Mary Skanderbeg spent years coordinating on of Manitoba's biggest events - the provincial elections! Prior to that, she spent over 10 years working as one of the first special needs teaching assistants in Winnipeg's public schools.

Of Icelandic heritage, Mary is now an Amma (Icelandic for Grandma) 10 times over! Recently retired, she moved to Gimli, MB and now divides her time between consulting, travelling, babysitting and revisiting her passion for creative writing for children. A much requested favourite by her - The Princess and the Nut-pea.

The team isn't complete though. We need people like YOU to join our team and help us get through to the next phase!

Why we need your help and how we will thank you:

To create the Tindra Tales books, materials (photography, soundscape and stories) must first be collected in Iceland. We are asking for your support to make this happen.

Team members Hugh Conacher and Angela Chalmers will be meeting Jon Gustafsson in Iceland this September. We have chosen this time to go as there is a group of Winnipeg artists who will also be travelling then. Travelling together will keep costs down.

Breakdown:

For Angela Chalmers and Hugh Conacher to travel for three weeks in Iceland, the following has been budgeted:

  • Airfare, transportation (including a one week trip to small towns and remote island areas) and accommodations: $3,500 each
  • Research, food, networking, any additional photography and audio gear that may be required*: $1,500 each
* The majority of the gear is being supplied by the team members themselves.


The trip's expected total comes to $10,000. Hugh and Angela have committed themselves to going. Your support will not go unrecognized. Public thank you's! Fun, beautiful perks! From homemade vinatarta to custom photographs taken in Iceland specifically for you! Have a character in one of the books named after you or a loved one! Take a look at our Perks page - you will definitely find something that interests you!

How will the project be completed?

The project is divided into four phases:

1.  Research and Fundraising: 
This is the phase we are completing right now. Research has included:

  • Learning about Icelandic folktales
  • Working through the logistics of executing the project's development and design
  • Putting together the most incredible team
Our primary focus from now until the end of August will be to continue with fundraising and prepare for Iceland. (April 2015-August 2015)

2.  Development:
All team members will have a role to play during the Development phase:

  • With the support of Jon Gustafsson, Hugh Conacher and Angela Chalmers will travel to Iceland to gather the photographs, stories and sounds needed to begin creating the books. Partnerships will be explored for distribution and future development of the books in Icelandic.
  • Disa Kauk will develop and hone her own technique to be used while illustrating on top of the photos being gathered.
  • After identifying themes for the stories, Mary Skanderbeg will begin sourcing specific folktales we will use. (September 2015-November 2015)

3. Design and Edit:

Materials will be compiled, story will be completed and the layout will be finalized. The Tindra Tales stories will then be edited. (December 2015-May 2016)

4.  Production and Distribution:

The Tindra Tales books will be printed using the highest of quality in everything. As these books have such a broad audience base, distribution will be a large task best conquered at the appropriate time by the most qualified people. (June 2016-November 2016) 

We are currently aiming for a November 2016 launch and distribution date - just in time for the 2016 holiday season!

Looking Forward

The Tindra Tales project has great potential for future endeavors - whether that is more Icelandic tales, tales from another country or the development of additional presentation formats of the books we will be creating. Join the team and be there from the start!

Potential Challenge

Our ability to maintain the timeline outlined above will be determined by our ability to raise the money needed to complete each phase of the project.
We need YOUR help!
If you have any questions or would like more information, please do not hesitate to send us an email: tindratales@gmail.com

Other Ways You Can Help

  • Follow us on social media. Like our Facebook page, follow our Twitter account and subscribe to our YouTube channel. 

  • Share our IndieGoGo campagin with everyone!

  • Share our social media sites with friends and family you think might be interested in our project. Word of mouth is the best chance we have of reaching our fundraising goal fast!

  • Email us with group, club and business names that might be interested in becoming a sponsor. Our email address is tindratales@gmail,com

  • Businesses and other organizations can contact us directly to determine an appropriate perk to best suit their needs.

Every donation gets us closer to our goal. Thank you for your support!
We cannot wait to share the final books with you. Enjoy your Perks!!!

story:
The LVX Natural Nail Color Remover

This revolutionary soy-based formula is designed to moisturize and penetrate the nails for an ultra hydrating experience. 

LVX is a luxury, vegan and cruelty free nail lacquer brand. We successfully launched our company over 3 years ago and now have over 80 colors in our line with 5 treatment products. 

Our socially responsible brand focuses on delivering luxury and healthy nail care. 

We want to offer our customers a top-to-bottom LVX experience. This is where our brand new, Natural Nail Color Remover comes in.

100% Natural & Biodegradable 

We sought to create a healthy solution to the harsh and toxic acetone formulas on the market.

Our plant based formula has a unique blend of ingredients which nourish and strengthen your nails and cuticles. Treat yourself to a luxurious experience all while removing nail color.

The LVX Nail Color Remover contains Vitamins A, C, & E and pure jojoba oil. 

In Addition, our formula is: 

  • Vegan
  • Non-Toxic & Odorless
  • Non-Drying
  • Cruelty Free 

Help us complete our treatment line! 

Over the years we have received countless requests from customers and retailers to produce a healthy top-to-bottom LVX nail care system.

Thus far, we have launched 5 unique products within our treatment line:

  • 3 in 1 Treatment
  • Base Coat
  • Gel Like Top Coat
  • Velvet Top Coat 
  • Green Tea Nail Oil 


With your help, we’re ready to complete the final product for our nail care system.


We’ve worked closely with a team of chemists to create the formula and now we just need help from you to get this amazing product on the market.

By backing us, you will receive the LVX Natural Nail Color Remover. We wanted to be sure that every reward level included our actual product.

We are revolutionizing this industry and we want you to do it with us.



Project Timeline

  • January 2015 - September 2015: Research and Development
  • October 2015: First Prototypes Created
  • November - December 2015: IndieGoGo Crowd Funding
  • January - February 2016: First Production Run
  • March 2016: All IndieGoGo Pre-Orders Begin to Ship!
story_txt:
The LVX Natural Nail Color Remover This revolutionary soy-based formula is designed to moisturize and penetrate the nails for an ultra hydrating experience. 



LVX is a luxury, vegan and cruelty free nail lacquer brand. We successfully launched our company over 3 years ago and now have over 80 colors in our line with 5 treatment products. 
Our socially responsible brand focuses on delivering luxury and healthy nail care. 
We want to offer our customers a top-to-bottom LVX experience. This is where our brand new, Natural Nail Color Remover comes in.


100% Natural & Biodegradable 


We
sought to create a healthy solution to the harsh and toxic acetone formulas
on the market.


Our
plant based formula has a unique blend of ingredients which
nourish and
strengthen your nails and cuticles. Treat
yourself to a luxurious
experience all while
removing nail color.


The
LVX Nail Color Remover contains Vitamins A, C, & E and pure jojoba oil. 
In Addition, our formula is: 


Vegan
Non-Toxic & Odorless
Non-Drying
Cruelty Free 




Help us complete our treatment line! 

 

Over
the years we have received countless requests from customers and retailers to
produce a healthy top-to-bottom LVX nail care system.


Thus
far, we have launched 5 unique products within our treatment line: 


3 in 1 Treatment
Base Coat
Gel Like Top Coat
Velvet Top Coat 

Green Tea Nail Oil 



With
your help, we’re ready to complete the final product for our nail care system.




We’ve
worked closely with a team of chemists to create the formula and
now we just need help from you to get this amazing
product on the market.
By
backing us, you will receive the LVX Natural Nail Color Remover. We wanted to
be sure that every reward level included our actual product. 
We
are revolutionizing this industry and we want you to do it with us.





    Project Timeline
    January 2015 - September 2015: Research and Development
 October 2015: First Prototypes Created 

November - December 2015: IndieGoGo Crowd Funding
January - February 2016: First Production Run 

March 2016: All IndieGoGo Pre-Orders Begin to Ship!

story:
DELIGHTFUL DAISY earrings:
                                                                                                   Beautiful silver earrings 
                                                                                                   with 22k gold pollen:
                                                                         


Hello, Thank-you so much for clicking onto my campaign. AK Jewellery Design is a new company that produces lovely, elegant well-made pieces of jewellery that aren't mass produced but also aren't wildly expensive.

I create jewellery for discerning women who want to feel wonderful. We use quality materials because, much like the best ingredients produce the best food, using the best quality gems, silver and gold, leads to the loveliest jewellery.      

The company has got off to a great start, using savings and borrowing money, but I really want to grow the company and develop it, and I’d love you to be involved.

I'm not expecting anything for nothing, and if you pledge money you’ll receive jewellery worth more than the money you pledge, along with a certificate, newsletter, invitations and the chance to see our new designs, and meet the designer (and even have a range of jewellery named after you or your loved one - take a look at our amazing rewards & perks).   

We'd love you to get involved in a project that's creative and artistic but based on solid business sense!

 

A bit more about AK:

I have always loved fashion & design and started going on jewellery courses a few years ago, keen to design and make my own pieces. What started as a fun way to spend the evenings developed into an obsession! Loads of design courses, art courses, certificates and years of practice and I found people always asked me where I got my jewellery from. When I said I made it, they were amazed...so I decided to set up my own company...just a small organisation, operating from the conservatory.

My primary aim was to fill the gap. To create beautiful, simple, elegant jewellery for women aged 40+ who are not catered for by many current companies who focus on mass production of cheap jewellery for younger women. I also wanted to make sure that the jewellery was affordable!

 

Attributes

The jewellery is modern, pretty and easy-to wear. We use sterling silver and fine silver as well as precious stones and 22k gold. The price points are reasonable - most items in our collection can be bought for under £50, and there are no items on the site for over £150.

 

Why jewellery?

Jewellery can be amazing: it can be vibrant, personal and enchanting. It sits directly on your skin so is close to you physically as well as emotionally. And it can stay with you for a lifetime. The best items of jewellery are like small pieces of art. They reflect how you feel and represent who you are. And they make you look absolutely gorgeous in the process!


Why are we on IndieGoGo?

I need to expand the business but don't want to borrow from a bank, because I love the idea of the project being led and molded by those who love and wear the jewellery. 

   

What do we do that's different?

Every collection I produce has a lovely story behind it. My jewellery is driven by art and creativity. It's not wacky and unwearable, and neither is it monstrously expensive. It's just a bit different.

For example, there's a range called Daisy Crazy which burst into life after I went rushing through London one day, and dashed through Hyde Park. It’s a very elegant park, and at the Kensington end of it there were mainly people dressed in a business-like manner…speeding through with their mobile phones pressed to their ears, locked in their own corporate worlds.

Then, on the grass to the side, I saw a group of young women making daisy chains. The scene was beautiful – ­ gorgeous sunshine and rich, green grass, with the women all wearing light summer colours as they smiled and created.

Every daisy chain they made, they placed onto their friend’s head, wrist or around their neck…each looking more ethereal and more lovely with every additional daisy chain.

They were so happy in one another’s company and so ‘in the moment’ – a million miles away from the hustle and bustle just outside the park.

It was enchanting, and reminded me of the beauty and simplicity of nature and the loveliness of female friendship.

I wanted to try and recreate some of that feeling in jewellery, so I dragged myself  away and designed a range of silver and gold daisy jewellery that could all be worn together…like the daisy chains on that lovely summer’s afternoon in the park, or on their own – as one, simple elegant piece inspired by loveliness and tranquillity in a busy life.

How lovely to have a formal suit, and a hectic, busy life, but have a simple silver and gold daisy necklace or earrings to remind you that nature is around every corner, and female friends are valuable and special.

Daisy Crazy:       

Use of Funds:

Incase you're wondering what we will be doing to grow the business...these are our plans:

1. I need to bring in two apprentices who I can train in jewellery making, as well as an assistant to organise fulfillment and the day to day business of AK Jewellery

2. PR: I need to get out there and make sure everyone knows about us, and what we're doing. This is one of the critical areas of setting up a new business, but it's so hard to spend money on it when you're trying to keep costs down.

3. Marketing: We want to retain a PR firm for crucial times, like leading up to Valentines Day, to make sure our lovely jewels are in people's minds when they're thinking about buying presents

4. Social media: We need to do a social media blitz with video / images / website links

5. Accounts: Yep - the boring side. But we need to bring on an accountant to make sure this side of the business is in order. 

6. Buying: In order to keep things fresh and exciting I need to get out there and source the right materials and come back with stones & gems that are exactly right for us. I also need to be able to start buying in bulk in order to get the best deals possible.

7. Business: I need expert advice on how to position and run the business.

  

Please join us! We have lots of exciting plans, but we need investment to get them off the ground. Thanks for your time!


If you have any questions, please contact us on: 

alison@akjewellerydesign.com

story:
MEET THE DIN WALLETS...

The slim wooden wallets, that will keep your cards safe, with minimalism, elegance and style!
   


 

THE STORY

HAVEN'T YOU ALL BROKE A CARD?!
WELL I DID! AND LOTS OF THEM!
Tired of breaking my cards with a regular wallet, I had to do something! I picked up two pieces of plywood and an office rubber band and made, what became the first protoype, just to personal use. Eight months latter not a single card was broken! 

My friends started asking for one and I realized it had the potential to become a business. I evolved the design, introduced real wood and tested the product with real customers.  

And so my passion was born! DIN Wallets, the minimalist wooden wallets that will keep your cards safe from slipping and breaking.  

— Guilherme Nunes (C.E.O. & Head Designer)


HOW IT WORKS


CORE FEATURES

Minimalist Design
Assembling the natural wood porperties witha a strict milimetrical design, we gave birth to a slim, light and elegant wallet.

Keep Your Cards Safe
The wood's resistance allied with the rubber's strenght will keep your cards safe from slipping and breaking.

Multiple Wood Types
With a large variety of wood types, we can offer a wide range of natural colors, shades and patterns to match your style.

Crafts & Technology Together
Our production process joins the best in two worlds, merging the traditional woodworking skills with the precision of CNC machinery.


WOOD TYPES


FOLLOW OUR SOCIAL NETWORKS




Risks & Challenges

There are almost no risks in our operation since we've been studying and testing with consummers for over a year. 

We can produce a large quantity in a short time. We will also be producing the wallets as they are ordered so that we will be able to deliver the goods right after the campaign ends.

We are now in touch with the best shipping services in order to get the best service. 

You contact us anytime via email or phone and we will be glad to deal with your doubts.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you read this far, it means you are one of the coolest person on earth!

Please continue growing your "coolness" and share our project in your social networks!

story:
My name is Gagandeep Singh , and I live in Northern India, in a town called Chandigarh.

When the whole world was hit by the recent recession, I was affected as were many many others, and trying to think of a solution to the poor trading and work prospects, I decided to turn my interests into a business, and so my personal collection of vintage timepieces became my route into a new venture.

 

I had travelled widely and always took the opportunity to view old watches wherever I was able, and seeing the state of some of these elderly beauties, lying unloved and unwanted in the face of the quartz revolution saddened me.

 

I therefore purchased whatever my pocket would allow, and with the assistance of a small group of artisans, I began the refurbishment process, and found myself with a small but quality stock of sellable watches, and the business started.

 

I have developed a worldwide customer base, with a superb feedback rating, and I wish to further develop this marketplace with more diverse and upmarket timepieces, as these are much sought after in more recent times, as collectors have been drawn back into the mechanical, quality watch market, and India is a good place to find these.

 

It would be a very satisfying business to operate, and it would allow me and many other associated skilled watch makers professionals gone work less to maintain a venture of quality products for the discerning market.

  • I need this money to upgrade stock and add few high end watches too.
  • After a purchase its time to put a life back to them and for that you need to hire more competent professional watchmakers who could serviced them nicely and get them running .Than comes few small machines which could help fine tuning the watch's internal mechanism and help finding small problems such as accuracy hands alignment etc.
  • After all this process you need to get them professionally polished ..
  • After few other small required steps the watch is ready put a nice band and feel proud to see that dying beauty smiling and dancing once again, a feeling that cannot be easily explained in words.

     

    I need this dream project to be completed and made a success, and if you think you may be able to assist us in the venture, I will be pleased to present you with a sample of my product, so you can see for yourselves the joy of a beautifully restored friend to sit on your wrist.

     

    I have now spent 5 years on the project, reading and researching the market and the products, and I have built-up my contacts and resources, and I am ready to take the next step, with your help.

     

    One last thing, India has not always had a good reputation for honest dealings in the watch field, but I am a 100% business, as can be seen from my customer feedback, and I also offer a full warranty on any items purchased, my products are my bond, and customers can be rest assured they are purchasing full quality goods with my company’s name on them.
