When the whole world was hit by the recent recession, I was affected as were many many others, and trying to think of a solution to the poor trading and work prospects, I decided to turn my interests into a business, and so my personal collection of vintage timepieces became my route into a new venture.
 
I had travelled widely and always took the opportunity to view old watches wherever I was able, and seeing the state of some of these elderly beauties, lying unloved and unwanted in the face of the quartz revolution saddened me.
 
I therefore purchased whatever my pocket would allow, and with the assistance of a small group of artisans, I began the refurbishment process, and found myself with a small but quality stock of sellable watches, and the business started.
 
I have developed a worldwide customer base, with a superb feedback rating, and I wish to further develop this marketplace with more diverse and upmarket timepieces, as these are much sought after in more recent times, as collectors have been drawn back into the mechanical, quality watch market, and India is a good place to find these.
 
It would be a very satisfying business to operate, and it would allow me and many other associated skilled watch makers professionals gone work less to maintain a venture of quality products for the discerning market.

I need this money to upgrade stock and add few high end watches too.
After a purchase its time to put a life back to them and for that you need to hire more competent professional watchmakers who could serviced them nicely and get them running .Than comes few small machines which could help fine tuning the watch's internal mechanism and help finding small problems such as accuracy hands alignment etc.
After all this process you need to get them professionally polished ..
After few other small required steps the watch is ready put a nice band and feel proud to see that dying beauty smiling and dancing once again, a feeling that cannot be easily explained in words. 
I need this dream project to be completed and made a success, and if you think you may be able to assist us in the venture, I will be pleased to present you with a sample of my product, so you can see for yourselves the joy of a beautifully restored friend to sit on your wrist.
 
I have now spent 5 years on the project, reading and researching the market and the products, and I have built-up my contacts and resources, and I am ready to take the next step, with your help.
 
One last thing, India has not always had a good reputation for honest dealings in the watch field, but I am a 100% business, as can be seen from my customer feedback, and I also offer a full warranty on any items purchased, my products are my bond, and customers can be rest assured they are purchasing full quality goods with my company’s name on them.

story:
What is The Beehive Box? 

My name is Marisa and I own The Fuzzy Bee Paper Company, an online paper store illustrated and printed in Glasgow, Scotland. For many years I have offered a monthly card subscription in my shop and always dreamed of expanding this part of my business. I am finally achieving this goal by launching The Beehive Box, a tiered subscription service of locally curated, handpicked and awesome illustrators and makers that come right to your door. Beehive Box has 3 principles: 


Our 3 Beehive Principles

SUPPORTING SMALL BUSINESS

As a small business owner it is incredibly hard to struggle in the market and get your products seen. Many artists own and manage multiple online shops, attend a million craft fairs, and approach local shops to carry their goods with the hopes of making a living and having their work reach your hands. Artists typically sell their work at a wholesale price making anywhere from 20-50%  profit on the goods they make with no guarantee they are making it to consumers. Other times they are asked to give work for free in return for marketing or social media. The Beehive Box wants to combat this. Creatives need and should be making a living for the work they make and The Beehive Box plans to support artist income EVERY step of the way. Anytime an item is purchased in a box or our online shop they will be receiving at minimum 50% profit. 

KNOWING WHAT YOU SPEND

From buying and selling cards first hand I know how much people love paper products. The one thing that confused me was how people sourced their cards. My own friends were often guilty of this and were always apologising  for giving me a "cheap" card for occasions they bought at the local drug store ten minutes before a party. What they didn't realise is they were paying the same amount for their cheap card as they would from a handmade local maker or small shop. The average card is fairly expensive and many people do not realise how much that money adds up after a while. The Beehive Box plans to source and curate cute and adorable products at a fair and reasonable price. So your cost is the same as stopping by a local CVS but we come to you. This also means you will now be the cool person at the party who brought the adorable card. Your friends and family will thank you. 

HAVE FUN

I am obsessed with box subscriptions. I know they are the rage right now but that is because of their awesomeness. It is an affordable way to receive unique products you never knew about. What I love about The Beehive Box is it the gift that keeps giving. Many of the cards or products inside the box can be given as gifts or for occasions. They are also for YOU! Let's be real. I am going to keep a lot of it. Frame some prints/cards, get some new notebooks, and discover some artists you never knew. 

What We Need & What You Get

 Here is what we need to get things started. 

WHAT WE NEED: 

  • Initial Stock/Packaging Supplies: We will be starting from scratch with our initial packing for the first two months of rolling subscriptions. Monies will also help to recruit local artists in the UK, EU, USA, and CAN. 
  • Photography: I think this is a major hurdle for local sellers. All stock in boxes will also be available in the store. We want to make sure everything looks perfect for online viewing and is ready for sale out to consumers.  
  • Marketing: The largest reason we are launching a campaign is to get the word out about BEEHIVE. Monies will be used to market on social media and online platforms. 
THE PERKS: 
I thought it was only natural that we work with local Sottish artists to get things going as this community in Glasgow and greater Scotland is awesome and arguably undiscovered territory. That is why I turned to the following artists for our first boxes and perks: (check out the perks section over here >>>>) Check out the Beehive Blog for full bios: http://www.thebeehivebox.com/blog/
Essi Illustration: A Finnish based print maker, Essi makes gorgeous and colourful works from her travels around the world. 
Not Only Polka Dots: With a degree in product design, Imanina produces the most adorable and fun notebook collections. 
Doris Does Doodles: Lesley is the proud owner of Doris Does Doodles. She has adorable products from mugs, notebooks, and brooches. Her items are to used every day of the week. 
Claire Barclay Draws: Claire owns the ultimate fun shop and uses traditional and fun Scottish slang throughout her works. She produces a range of brooches, bunting, cards and prints throughout her shop.  
Ingrid Petrie Design: Ingrid produces modern and adorable print designs ranging from children's prints to gorgeous graphics. 
Maddy Burrows: Just graduated, Maddy creates cute animal themed and quirky goods. She has a line of scarves, greeting cards, and pins perfect for every occasion.  
The Fuzzy Bee Paper Company (that's me!): Marisa produces sassy and quirky greeting cards and prints and has just moved to Scotland in July! 

The Impact

The impact for The Beehive Box reaches globally even though we are starting small:  

  • Your contribution to this campaign is a way to support up and coming makers and illustrators and will directly help the artists mentioned above for our first boxes. It is also going to change a makers life for boxes to come as we grow in size and they have more and more visibility. 
  • The Beehive Box is open worldwide for shipping. Just because you may live across the ocean doesn't mean you can't get some perks! 
  • Everyone involved in The Beehive Box has been doing this for a long time. We know all about printing, shipping, networking and want to get some goods into your hands. 


Risks & Challenges

We are starting small on purpose. That doesn't mean we don't want to be big. Here are some things we are working on: 

  • Making the boxes as affordable as possible is a huge task! We will be continually sourcing and experimenting with packaging as we speak so things are ready to go! 
  • We are always looking for new artists! I have hand selected my first artists from Glasgow/Scotland and will continue to source new makers. Typically small makers need to know in advance how much stock they need to supply. We will be working on stream lining this process for all of our boxes. We are working on developing and searching for new artists as well from the EU, USA, and CAN. If you are interested or have any questions please email marisa@thefuzzybee.com. 


Other Ways You Can Help

If you feel like this is not the time to contribute that is TOTES MAGOTES fine. We want to let you know you can contribute in one the biggest ways. Tell your friends and families about BEEHIVE and spread the word. 

  • You can head over to our Instagram @the.beehive.box or on Facebook at www.facebook.com/thebeehivebox
  • You can join the mailing list here and share our emails. 
  • You can use the awesome share tools right on this page! 
  • You can also skip to the fun part and just become a subscriber! Head over to www.thebeehivebox.com 

And that's all there is to it. We look forward to sending you some A-MAZING stuff.
story_txt:
What is The Beehive Box? 
 My name is Marisa and I own The Fuzzy Bee Paper Company, an online paper store illustrated and printed in Glasgow, Scotland. For many years I have offered a monthly card subscription in my shop and always dreamed of expanding this part of my business. I am finally achieving this goal by launching The Beehive Box, a tiered subscription service of locally curated, handpicked and awesome illustrators and makers that come right to your door. Beehive Box has 3 principles: 



Our 3 Beehive Principles






SUPPORTING SMALL BUSINESS
As a small business owner it is incredibly hard to struggle in the market and get your products seen. Many artists own and manage multiple online shops, attend a million craft fairs, and approach local shops to carry their goods with the hopes of making a living and having their work reach your hands. Artists typically sell their work at a wholesale price making anywhere from 20-50%  profit on the goods they make with no guarantee they are making it to consumers. Other times they are asked to give work for free in return for marketing or social media. The Beehive Box wants to combat this. Creatives need and should be making a living for the work they make and The Beehive Box plans to support artist income EVERY step of the way. Anytime an item is purchased in a box or our online shop they will be receiving at minimum 50% profit. 



KNOWING WHAT YOU SPEND
From buying and selling cards first hand I know how much people love paper products. The one thing that confused me was how people sourced their cards. My own friends were often guilty of this and were always apologising  for giving me a "cheap" card for occasions they bought at the local drug store ten minutes before a party. What they didn't realise is they were paying the same amount for their cheap card as they would from a handmade local maker or small shop. The average card is fairly expensive and many people do not realise how much that money adds up after a while. The Beehive Box plans to source and curate cute and adorable products at a fair and reasonable price. So your cost is the same as stopping by a local CVS but we come to you. This also means you will now be the cool person at the party who brought the adorable card. Your friends and family will thank you. 



HAVE FUN
I am obsessed with box subscriptions. I know they are the rage right now but that is because of their awesomeness. It is an affordable way to receive unique products you never knew about. What I love about The Beehive Box is it the gift that keeps giving. Many of the cards or products inside the box can be given as gifts or for occasions. They are also for YOU! Let's be real. I am going to keep a lot of it. Frame some prints/cards, get some new notebooks, and discover some artists you never knew. 






What We Need & What You Get

  Here is what we need to get things started. 
WHAT WE NEED: 
 
Initial Stock/Packaging Supplies: We will be starting from scratch with our initial packing for the first two months of rolling subscriptions. Monies will also help to recruit local artists in the UK, EU, USA, and CAN. 

Photography: I think this is a major hurdle for local sellers. All stock in boxes will also be available in the store. We want to make sure everything looks perfect for online viewing and is ready for sale out to consumers.  

Marketing: The largest reason we are launching a campaign is to get the word out about BEEHIVE. Monies will be used to market on social media and online platforms.  
THE PERKS: 
I thought it was only natural that we work with local Sottish artists to get things going as this community in Glasgow and greater Scotland is awesome and arguably undiscovered territory. That is why I turned to the following artists for our first boxes and perks: (check out the perks section over here >>>>) Check out the Beehive Blog for full bios: http://www.thebeehivebox.com/blog/



Essi Illustration: A Finnish based print maker, Essi makes gorgeous and colourful works from her travels around the world. 

Not Only Polka Dots: With a degree in product design, Imanina produces the most adorable and fun notebook collections. 


Doris Does Doodles: Lesley is the proud owner of Doris Does Doodles. She has adorable products from mugs, notebooks, and brooches. Her items are to used every day of the week. 


Claire Barclay Draws: Claire owns the ultimate fun shop and uses traditional and fun Scottish slang throughout her works. She produces a range of brooches, bunting, cards and prints throughout her shop.  


Ingrid Petrie Design: Ingrid produces modern and adorable print designs ranging from children's prints to gorgeous graphics. 


Maddy Burrows: Just graduated, Maddy creates cute animal themed and quirky goods. She has a line of scarves, greeting cards, and pins perfect for every occasion.  


The Fuzzy Bee Paper Company (that's me!): Marisa produces sassy and quirky greeting cards and prints and has just moved to Scotland in July! 




The Impact
 The impact for The Beehive Box reaches globally even though we are starting small:    Your contribution to this campaign is a way to support up and coming makers and illustrators and will directly help the artists mentioned above for our first boxes. It is also going to change a makers life for boxes to come as we grow in size and they have more and more visibility.  The Beehive Box is open worldwide for shipping. Just because you may live across the ocean doesn't mean you can't get some perks!  Everyone involved in The Beehive Box has been doing this for a long time. We know all about printing, shipping, networking and want to get some goods into your hands.     
Risks & Challenges  We are starting small on purpose. That doesn't mean we don't want to be big. Here are some things we are working on:   Making the boxes as affordable as possible is a huge task! We will be continually sourcing and experimenting with packaging as we speak so things are ready to go!  We are always looking for new artists! I have hand selected my first artists from Glasgow/Scotland and will continue to source new makers. Typically small makers need to know in advance how much stock they need to supply. We will be working on stream lining this process for all of our boxes. We are working on developing and searching for new artists as well from the EU, USA, and CAN. If you are interested or have any questions please email marisa@thefuzzybee.com.     
Other Ways You Can Help If you feel like this is not the time to contribute that is TOTES MAGOTES fine. We want to let you know you can contribute in one the biggest ways. Tell your friends and families about BEEHIVE and spread the word. 
 You can head over to our Instagram @the.beehive.box or on Facebook at www.facebook.com/thebeehivebox

You can join the mailing list here and share our emails. 
You can use the awesome share tools right on this page! 
You can also skip to the fun part and just become a subscriber! Head over to www.thebeehivebox.com    And that's all there is to it. We look forward to sending you some A-MAZING stuff.

story:
Les fonds seront ventilés comme ceci :

- paiement des webmasters   webmasters fees

- paiement designers                 designers fees

- nouveaux locaux                       new offices

- augmentation de capital ( frais juridique également)   capital increase


L'idée de ce site est protégée juridiquement

La société LOKAWEB immatriculée sur Avignon s'occupe de créer ce site web sur le loto.

LOKAWEB Company is located on Avignon (south of France) and is creating this website about lotery.

Des capitaux sont engagés ainsi que beaucoup de webmasters en freelance ayant chacun leurs spécificités.

Funds are deployed to success and many webmasters are working for the same purpose

Vous rêvez de gagner le jackpot du loto ?! c'est maintenant possible avec ce nouveau site en construction !! aidez nous à le financer !

Your dream is possible with our website ! don't worry we'll win the jackpot !!


Fonctionnement du site

Ce site propose de jouer sur les lotos Americain , Euro million , Français n'importe ou sur la planète.

You can play everywhere at American lotery, French lotery, Euro million

Le site se rémunère sur les pourcentages de gains des joueurs (3%) ; Ainsi le joueur peut avoir accès à une plateforme de statistiques (de chaque loto) de probabilités, de logiciel flash (éditer des suggestions de jeux) unique au monde.

The website fees are 3% by earnings and players have many access to statistics, software etc..

Il n'existe pas de site tel que nous le proposons et aussi abouti.

No website exist also accomplished

Une appli est également en cours de création et pourra fonctionner sur tous les smartphones et tablettes.

We are creating software to play on smartphones and tablets

La communauté de joueurs inscrits sur ce site mise ensemble et la totalité des gains du site web, à chaque tirage, est redistribué au prorata des mises des joueurs.

Players community bets on website and all earnings are shared.

Un joueur qui attrape le jackpot conserve 70% des gains et le reste redistribué aux joueurs. L'avantage indéniable est la multiplicité des tickets achetés sur le site : plus la communauté est grande et joue beaucoup et plus la chance de voir le jackpot est grande !! l'union fait la force !

The player who has been win jackpot, he keeps 60% and the rest is sharing between all players


Composition de l'offre sur le site

- packs : differents niveaux de packs sont proposés avec des options ; paiements mensuels

- grille simple et individuelle : chaque joueurs peut jouer le nombre de grille qu'il veut ( le joueur paie la grille jouée)

- mise en ligne chaque semaines de suggestions de jeux (calculés à l'aide du logiciel de stats)

- accès aux statistiques de chaque loto

- édition des meilleurs joueurs : un voyage à gagner à la fin de l'année pour le meilleur joueur

Many packs are elaborate to each players


Sécurité

- paiements sécurisés

- compte personnel (obligatoire pour récupérer les gains)

- Conditions générales de ventes

- charte de joueur

Maximum security on website (paypal , visa , SSL, general terms etc..)

story:
Meet N3R

Natalia Rachel Radwan-Richard, the creator of N3R was born and raised in Warsaw, the capital of Poland. Her mother is Polish and her father has Canadian and Native American roots. Natalia has been a very creative person since a very young age. She did a lot of artistic activities in the pass that helped her develop her passion for art and fashion. Her biggest inspiration is her mother Wanda, who introduced her into the Opera world. The Polish National Opera specially, gave this young designer the inspiration to explore her artistic skills.

The creation of N3R and what is actually N3R?

N3R, the name of the brand ,is basically inspired by the name of the creator: Natalia Rachel Radwan-Richard. But there is also a deeper meaning to it ,since it also stand for three basic and descriptive concepts. Recycle, Re-use and Reduce. Those three words really express the direction Natalia wants her current and future collections to take. One of the most important things when she creates, is the use of recycled fabric. She really cares about the environment and believes that there are so many ways to look fabulous, while remaining socially conscious and fashionably ethical. Finally ,she focuses her ideas and projects believing that supporting conscious fashion, folkloric fabrics, recycled items and the use of local clothing’s can lead to great and inspirational creations. All these ideals combined together are N3R. As Antoine Lavoisie said: “Nothing is lost, nothing is created, and everything is transformed”

The philosophy of buying local came from the principle of buying is voting. Our society needs to be more responsible when consuming. The purpose is not to convince the public to stop buying brand new items, but to convince them that a more fair, ethical and consciously purchased fashion is possible while supporting and contributing for the economy. 

The Goal

If this project is successfully funded, N3R will be able to produce more clothing and become more accessible to other cities and costumers. In order to expand the concept of wearing fair, ethical, and consciously purchased fashion made with love and recycled fabrics.

Why 3000$ ?

This amount is necessary for the equipment, for the fabrics, to pay press & publicity and also to pay the seamstress.

To read more about N3R:

http://farline-blog.blogspot.ca/2014/10/n3r-fashion-should-be-fair-ethical-and_7.html?m=1

Watch the interview at MAtv with N3R:

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=I6ufqrCWpvI

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=XBYBlcZk0Co

Rewards

Elephant collection carts to bring you good luck and to reward your engagement. 


Every T-shirt for a perk will be unique, tell us your size and the colour that you want to have (red, black, blue, white, grey, pink, brown, yellow, orange or green). 


N3R jacket for HER made from recycled fabrics.


Hand Made Poster "Womanity" Limited Collection.



Painting Canvas by N3R #1.



Painting Canvas by N3R #2.

Get in touch:

FB: www.facebook.com/N3Rexclusive

Mail: n3rexclusive@gmail.com

Thank you! 

From N3R with love!

story:
Summary

Be The Best Sport is an adaptive sports programs for children and adults with special needs. The program began just over five years ago with 5 children and we are projected to service an estimated 250+ children and adults in 2015. Be The Best Sport offers a variety of sports and programs for all ages, including but not limited to baseball, basketball, bike riding, fitness, karate, multi-sport, soccer, tennis, and track & field. 

Be The Best Sport seeks to offer high quality programming that is affordable to all athletes regardless of socioeconomic status. Each of our programs are run by trained professionals who have worked in the field and have vast experience working with children and adults with special needs. 

Our motto is to "Have FUN, make FRIENDS, and always leave with a SMILE" and is what motivates us each week to provide a great experience that our athletes will remember for a lifetime.

Our Goals and Your Perks

In this campaign, we are looking to raise $10,000 in order to help lower program costs to participants in our programs.

With each dollar raised, we are offering unique perks to thank you for your contributions towards our goal!

PERKS

$5 - Be The Best Sport Support Silicone Wristband

$15 -  Personal shout out on Facebook and Twitter

$25 - Be The Best Sport Postcard with pictures of children and adults that you are helping to provide sport enrichment program opportunities to!

$50 - Free Trial Sponsor - Help provide free trial classes for 2 children/adults

$85 - Be The Best Sport Supporter Magnet

$100 -  Be The Best Sport Supporter T-Shirt

$300 - Be The Best Sport Supporter - Glass Desk Trophy

$500 - Special Olympics Basketball Team Sponsor - Your name or business on the back of our team jerseys  from September 2015 - 2016 (1 available)

$500 - Scholarship Sponsor - Help reduce the costs of programs by 50% for 33 athletes. Your name or company posted on our website as a program sponsor from September 2015 - September 2016 programs. 

$1000 - T-Shirt Sponsor - Your name or business on all of our staff & participant t-shirts from September 2015 - September 2016 (2 available)

$1000 - Scholarship Sponsor - Help reduce the costs of programs by 50% for 66 athletes. Your name or company posted on our website as a program sponsor from September 2015 - September 2016 programs. 


All funds raised will help us continue to offer our programs at reduced rates to participants.

The Impact

Through outside funding and campaigns like this, we are able to cut program fees to participants up to 50%, maintain a high quality program, keep class sizes small, and employ the highest quality staff.

In 2014, we were able to offer 90 participants a 50% fee reduction because of fundraising campaigns.

In 2015, we currently have funding to offer 190 fee reductions to participants and are looking to offer at least 250 fee reductions.

With increased funding from campaigns like this, we have been able to incrementally increase the size of our program and service more participants each year for the last 5 years. Lower program fees help us impact more children and adults. With higher participation rates, we are able to apply for more funding from private donors and foundations and continue to fulfill our goal of providing a high quality program at a low cost to participants families. 

Help be a part of our mission to service more children and adults than 2014!

Risks & Challenges

Participants with special needs often have higher financial obligations due to the highs costs of the services they need. Part of our mission, is to alleviate some of the financial burden of participating in our program, and offer a low cost option for a needed service. 

We have been able to overcome these challenges with generous funding and successful fundraising campaigns but are always looking to help more athletes each year. Help us fulfill our goal this year and help us provide even more scholarships than in 2014!

Other Ways You Can Help

If you are unable to donate monetarily, there are still ways to help us out!

Help Spread The Word

Post our fundraising campaign on your social media page and share with others! The more eyes we have on our campaign, the better chance we have at reaching our goal!

Volunteer At A Program

We have between 30 - 40 volunteers each week who help our participants in a variety of sport enrichment programs. Participants love seeing their volunteer each week and often become emotionally attached. Seeing their volunteer or peer buddy each week brings a smile to the participants face and helps them "leave with a SMILE."

story:
NOW YOU CAN BUY SMARTRULER 2.0 ON AMAZON OR EBAY

https://www.amazon.com/dp/B0743NH4PY

https://www.ebay.com/usr/mrfmultitool

https://www.etsy.com/shop/MRFmultitools

Our Story 

We are MRF Engineering. Our team consists from skilled design engineers (mechanics, technologists, electronics engineers and electricians). Since 2010 MRF-ENGINEERING has been engaged in development of various plug-and-produce equipment (general mechanical engineering, conveyor and automated systems, vending and automatic selling machines, etc.)

But all of us are crazy about multitools and cool gear. So we decided to open MRF Multitools department and to create excellent multitools for everyone for every day.

Our goal was to make a creative tool that was simple, elegant, functional, and easy to use. We wanted a tool that will be good for a student or teacher, office worker or an engineer, designer or just a person who loves smart things. It needs to be credit card size and easily fit in your wallet, Pocket or sketchbook.

We thought it would be great to have of a ruler, bottle opener, protractor, compass, hex bit driver, headphones organizer and cell phone stand in our pockets. We checked a lot of different multitools and rulers and after long brainstorming we created Smartruler. 

The First Prototype was Smartruler 1.0. Black and White Edition. 

Why Aircraft-grade aluminum???

Smartrulers are machined out of a single piece of 6061 aircraft-grade aluminum, a strong enough material that airplanes and your Iphone are made of. We tested our first prototypes during the year. Smartruler 1.0 prototypes were shipped worldwide and tested by different people in USA, Canada, UK, Australia, Norway and China. 

All the feedback was mentioned from our users and SmartRuler 2.0 was designed.

First Smartrulers 2.0 were manufactured in late 2016. 

The First SmartRuler 2.0 prototypes just after laser engraving.

 

Final version Smartruler for Indiegogo side A

Final version Smartruler for Indiegogo side B

Main Features

-6061 non-bendable 1,5 mm anodized aluminum

-Ruler  imperial & metric
-Compass  circles 1” to 6” in diameter 

- Compass circles 10mm to 150mm in diameter

-Standard circles 6mm 10mm 12mm diameter

-Standard circles 1/2" 7/16" 3/8" 1/4" diameter

- Protractor  1˚ increments 

-Radian protractor

-Exact protractor 1/3 degree scale

-Quick angle 30˚ 45˚ 60˚ 90˚
-Draws parallel lines
-T-square
-Straightedge

-Headphones organizer

-Mobile phone stand

-Bottle opener

-Hex bit holder 1/4’’

Same dimensions as a credit card

Weight 0,5 oz (14 gramms)


all this was drawn by Smartruler


Laser cutted and marked for permanence
Designed and manufactured in Ukraine, Europe

Creative tool Smartruler 2.0

Not only technology

We are trying to leave the smallest ecological footprint possible. Our products are minimally packaged and shipped in bubble mailers made of 100% recyclable material.

Funding

The funds gathered will be used to help cover costs for...

- Large minimum order quantities from factory. 

- Packaging and shipping.

-Advertisement

Every funded dollar is not just money for us, it’s recognition by You!

 

Project Timeline

May 31  Campaign ends
June 1-15 Receiving money

June 16- 23Order aluminum sheets

June 24-31 Cut aluminum sheets, anodize

July 1-7 Laser marking, packaging prep

July 8-10 Packaging and shipping!

 

Risks & Challenges

The most important part of business is communication, and over the next few months we will dedicate a lot of time to just talking to you guys. Not only do we want to tell you how it's all going, but we want to send weekly videos on how to use all the tools.

Other Ways You Can Help

There are other ways you can help us bring SmartRuler around the Globe.

Make some noise!  There are buttons at the top of this page where you can easily share our campaign via Facebook, Twitter and other social media sites.  You can also create a link to email your friends.
story_txt: NOW YOU CAN BUY SMARTRULER 2.0 ON AMAZON OR EBAYhttps://www.amazon.com/dp/B0743NH4PYhttps://www.ebay.com/usr/mrfmultitoolhttps://www.etsy.com/shop/MRFmultitoolsOur Story We are MRF Engineering. Our team consists from skilled design engineers (mechanics, technologists, electronics engineers and electricians). Since 2010 MRF-ENGINEERING has been engaged in development of various plug-and-produce equipment (general mechanical engineering, conveyor and automated systems, vending and automatic selling machines, etc.)But all of us are crazy about multitools and cool gear. So we decided to open MRF Multitools department and to create excellent multitools for everyone for every day.Our goal was to make a creative tool that was simple, elegant, functional, and easy to use. We wanted a tool that will be good for a student or teacher, office worker or an engineer, designer or just a person who loves smart things. It needs to be credit card size and easily fit in your wallet, Pocket or sketchbook.We thought it would be great to have of a ruler, bottle opener, protractor, compass, hex bit driver, headphones organizer and cell phone stand in our pockets. We checked a lot of different multitools and rulers and after long brainstorming we created Smartruler. The First Prototype was Smartruler 1.0. Black and White Edition. Why Aircraft-grade aluminum???Smartrulers are machined out of a single piece of 6061 aircraft-grade aluminum, a strong enough material that airplanes and your Iphone are made of. We tested our first prototypes during the year. Smartruler 1.0 prototypes were shipped worldwide and tested by different people in USA, Canada, UK, Australia, Norway and China. All the feedback was mentioned from our users and SmartRuler 2.0 was designed.First Smartrulers 2.0 were manufactured in late 2016. The First SmartRuler 2.0 prototypes just after laser engraving. Final version Smartruler for Indiegogo side AFinal version Smartruler for Indiegogo side BMain Features-6061 non-bendable 1,5 mm anodized aluminum-Ruler  imperial & metric-Compass  circles 1” to 6” in diameter - Compass circles 10mm to 150mm in diameter-Standard circles 6mm 10mm 12mm diameter-Standard circles 1/2" 7/16" 3/8" 1/4" diameter- Protractor  1˚ increments -Radian protractor-Exact protractor 1/3 degree scale-Quick angle 30˚ 45˚ 60˚ 90˚-Draws parallel lines-T-square-Straightedge-Headphones organizer-Mobile phone stand-Bottle opener-Hex bit holder 1/4’’Same dimensions as a credit cardWeight 0,5 oz (14 gramms)all this was drawn by SmartrulerLaser cutted and marked for permanenceDesigned and manufactured in Ukraine, EuropeCreative tool Smartruler 2.0Not only technologyWe are trying to leave the smallest ecological footprint possible. Our products are minimally packaged and shipped in bubble mailers made of 100% recyclable material.FundingThe funds gathered will be used to help cover costs for...- Large minimum order quantities from factory. - Packaging and shipping.-AdvertisementEvery funded dollar is not just money for us, it’s recognition by You! Project TimelineMay 31  Campaign endsJune 1-15 Receiving moneyJune 16- 23Order aluminum sheetsJune 24-31 Cut aluminum sheets, anodizeJuly 1-7 Laser marking, packaging prepJuly 8-10 Packaging and shipping! Risks & ChallengesThe most important part of business is communication, and over the next few months we will dedicate a lot of time to just talking to you guys. Not only do we want to tell you how it's all going, but we want to send weekly videos on how to use all the tools.Other Ways You Can HelpThere are other ways you can help us bring SmartRuler around the Globe.Make some noise!  There are buttons at the top of this page where you can easily share our campaign via Facebook, Twitter and other social media sites.  You can also create a link to email your friends.

story:
Fashion is ever evolving and now not only what we wear but how we sell it.  More and more teenagers are becoming financially self-sufficient with ecommerce.  Now is the time to start to teach our children innovation, & entrepreneurship.  My passion is fashion and entrepreneurship. It is my goal to create a brand that marries the two to teach your girls to become captains of the industry now.

My name is April Clark and I created my own path to become a fashion & beauty professional.  Nearly 10 years ago I sat on my living room floor and created my first fashion collection.  Fast forward to now I have been a full-time fashion professional for 4 years.  My expertise goes from fashion styling for publications to contributing to the local TV morning show to owning my own nail polish line to authoring style and beauty books.  My passion for fashion pushed me to be a successful entrepreneur.  

I am embarking on a new brand to take my passion for fashion and entrepreneurship to teach and inspire young girls to do what I did but at a much earlier age. Miss April Fashion Girlpreneur is inspired by my family background in the toy business.   My mother was a toy designer for some of the biggest toy companies in the business.  She is known for designing the Carrington baby doll from the hit dram Dynasty and the tummies for two of Care Bears: Cheer Bear and Funshine.   I remember seeing my mother create the best toys designed to teach children. 

So I went back to my roots.  

Miss April Fashion Girlpreneur ® is an 18” fashion doll created by, Fashion Stylist and Blogger, April Clark.  Miss April was created to teach girls a creative way to start a fashion and beauty business.  Through different mediums girls will learn how to style, dress and create fashions for their doll.  Miss April will come with a fashion sketch pad, pattern, dress form and accessories to get your daughter in the entrepreneurial mindset to create the fashion collection of her dreams. Miss April will share lessons in:

How to Shop

Style Tips (How To Dress for Your Age)

Retail Math + Measurements

Garment Care

Fashion History

Current Fashion

Careers in Fashion

How to Start Your Own Fashion Business

Textile

Drawing of the Croqui

Color Basics

Fashion Drawing Techniques

 

I am seeking to build a community and following for Miss April Fashion Girlpreneur.  This campaign is about garnering support for the long-haul.  If you “buy in” to this concept now you will buy into it throughout this process.  The funds that I am seeking are to prove the validity of the concept. If 10,000 people back this project that means more to me than the amount of money raised.  I am a successful entrepreneur, I am confident I can raise the funds but I want a community of teens, tweens, creatives, fashion lovers, educators, and entrepreneurs who see the vision and want to support the vision.

What We Need & What You Get

With your contribution you will help with the creation of an original doll. No stock doll, no stock clothing an original fashion doll with her own trademark identity like Cabbage Patch Kids or Barbie.  The contributions will be used to create an original prototype of Miss April Fashion Doll. I created great perks for you! A limited edition pattern for your girls of the Miss April Fashion Girlpreneur jacket and dress is available to contributors.  I designed a t-shirt for the little fashionistas using my favorite catch phrase, "I am a very stylish girl."  

I am seeking a first round crowd-raising goal of $7,500 to create a custom doll with unique mold, and create the textile for the doll. As I stated before this is about building a following, if you like it, you'll support it.

With your contribution you can help me teach entrepreneurship and fashion career skills to young girls.

 

Other Ways You Can Help

Please share this with your network especially those who have fashion careers. You can also support my boutique.  I am selling teen and tween clothing and accessories. www.whatwouldaprilwear.store

story:
Our Story

The Rocky Mountains are a very important and inspirational place to us, they offer an unparalleled paradise to anywhere else in the United States. When we think of the majesty of the Rocky Mountains, we think specifically of Colorado. Every place we have traveled in the world we run into people who are in love with Colorado and the Rocky Mountains. While we want everyone to enjoy the Rockies, we realize that much of our National Forests are being taken advantage of. We want to encourage people not only to gain inspiration from our national forests, but also give back and help preserve them. The main focus of our company is to donate money to the National Forest Foundation, which in turn, will plant trees in our nations National Forests. To put it simply, buy our products and we will plant trees!

What We Need

We are raising $12,000 to assists us in the production of merchandise, advertising, pop-up store front costs, and vendor/sponsor fees for our company launch/debut at the 2017 GoPro Games in Vail, CO.

  • Merchandise                        $8,000
  • Advertising                           $400
  • Pop-up store                        $1,000
  • Vendor/sponsor fee          $2,600

With $8,000, we will be able to produce 2,700 items which will plant 2,700 trees as a result of the event. We will also plant 1 tree for every item received in your perk package, which will result in an additional 480 trees.

Launching our company at the GoPro Games is a once in a lifetime opportunity for us to jump-start our brand and cause!

Help us reach our company launch goal of planting 3,000 trees!

 

What You Get

 

Perks

 

 

 

 

Our Impact

Buy our awesome apparel, plant trees, support the mountains that we all love, be inspired, and most importantly "dream colorfully!"

 

Other Ways You Can Help

 

Can't contribute, not a problem! Help us spread the word about our cause and campaign by sharing through social media! Help us make noise and show some love!

story:
Short Summary

We are a duo that creates Bespoke Clothing for Men & Women with a heavy focus on Unisex clothing. The brand was conceived from our romantic relationship, and wearing eachother's clothes. Tishka would take scissors to some of Seth's shirts, and hence where destroy came from. Seth creates all the patterns from scratch, and we grade to provide custom fits for our clients -  the builder. 

Fabrics are sourced in New York City & all items are locally made by both of us. 

What We Need & What You Get

Our goal is to raise $5,000 in order to invest in an industrial sewing machine & serger. We are currently working from a home machine, and our aim is to create garments that will last for a lifetime. 

Currently we offer our clients 1 year warranty on all custom made garments, and we would like to extend it to a lifetime guarantee with durable fabrics with well executed craftsmanship.

Rewards: 

$25 - $55 donation= customized t-shirt
$75 - $150 =  Multi-Media T-Shirt
$150 - $300 = Bespoke Jeans
$ 300 & up  = Collaborate on one item

The Impact

We are working with a community organization: Little Creative Class to offer sewing & pattern making classes to underpriveledged kids in New York City. When we meet our goal, we are donating our machines to the organization so that the kids have access to equipment. 

Risks & Challenges

There are risk & challenges with everything, but we are dedicated to reaching our goal by creating events with our peers to raise funds. We have our first showcase this Saturday in Brooklyn & will be diligent and active every step of the way to ensure that we reach our goal. 

Other Ways You Can Help

By sharing our campaign with a friend or on your social media networks. Every little bit helps.

story:
Short Summary

Good day all, My name is O C Thomas from Corby, Northamptonshire.

I have started this campaign simply to get essential support for my new shop/ creative centre project I plan to launch in Corby. 

I feel there is a lack of independent stores locally that stock unique fashion, homegrown brands and handpicked hard to find retro/vintage products. I source products that are 100% authentic and not commercial "lookalikes" . These products are grade A quality and originate from the 70s 80s and 90s. I will also be offering massive support to local independent brands and upcoming fashion designers.

There is also minimum support, if any, for local people wanting to create their very own clothing brands. I would offer free access to tools, equipment and guidance and this would be a huge benefit for upcoming fashion/ brand designers helping them to create a brand, a product and market it locally. My experience is in printed apparel and using illustrated/ design orientated artwork.

The shop will eventually aim to be a hub of activity and a place that offers quality retro, vintage and independent clothing at decent prices, a relaxed atmosphere and most especially, a new landmark for the town of Corby. It's backbone will focus on supporting upcoming brands and helping them launch their products using the shop as a platform and a foundation to grow.

Let's come together and create yet another positive talking point for the ever changing, community strong, small business powerhouse that is Corby Town.
Peace



What Have I achieved?

I have already successfully launched my very own brand www.theoctbrand.com which offers an exclusive selection of hand-drawn illustrations printed onto a collection of high quality garments. This collection has caught the attention of a few celebrities in the street scene such as Charlie Sloth from Radio 1xtra, rappers from Brooklyn USA and London and even the likes of Jethro Sheeran and his more well known cousin, Ed. 

For the shop project, I, myself, have already gathered enough funds to secure a small space to run the shop from and kick start the business. This will keep me in this space for a solid amount of time, enough to gather a following and upgrade to a larger premises later on.

I will run the online shop and small creative centre from this space, hold some stock, offer collection and fittings of the products and operate my design work from a small desk. I have also invested in the beginnings of some stock which has been hard because I am yet to gain solid knowledge of my customers buying habits.

I will also be funding my own marketing campaign, website, shop branding and daily running costs.

Already, I have built a healthy local following by setting up a Facebook group. This group has helped me gather good market research and allowed me to find out how much in demand this project would be. The results have been incredible.https://www.facebook.com/groups/999405826784967/


What I Need Help With.

I have applied to and approached several local funding movements with no luck. I have been told that there is a huge lack of current available funding in Northamptonshire, which to me, seems strange as I always see lots of promotion about it. 
So I am asking for help directly from the people. The people who matter. My potential customers, local communities and genuine people who see a positive outcome in this project. People who know young creatives who will benefit from this and people who can vision the growth and success of this journey in time.
Furniture and equipment is something I cannot afford to fund.
I need help to setup a small area free to use for young people wanting to create and produce their own range to sell on the shop. This are will help people brand, design and produce their very own ranges and sell them locally. 
I will make the best use of the space I currently have, fitting everything into a well designed layout, ready to use. The funding will go towards the following:

Shelving units for the clothing ( shoe racks, tall box units and ) 
 X 2 apple macs for the creative area installed with Adobe Cs6 software ( Photoshop & Illustrator) 
 X 1 large slimline desk ( for the creative area) 
 X 2 chairs ( for the creative area) 
 X 2 headphones ( for the creative area)
X 1 digital Canon 60d camera for creatives to photograph/ film their products. 
 Laminate / removable hard flooring for the space. 
X 1 Large mirror and privacy screen ( for trying on items )

X 1 sofa
Light furnishings, lighting and decor ( Including paint and services of graffiti artists, a large rug, lamps and lighting, signage for the shop )
Storage boxes and drawers for tools and loose equipment.



The Thank-you Gifts!

I never expect something for nothing so I would like to offer the following: 
A VIP loyalty card which will entitle you to 20% of ANY purchases, UNLIMITED use, for a period of 1, 2 or 3 months. 
There will only be 50-100 each of these made up and they will not be produced again. 
You will also be given your very own unique online discount code so you can use the same discount when shopping online!
Please see the PERKS section for prices on the thank-you gifts.
Your time period on the card will only start once you have made your FIRST purchase. Your card will be valid for 1, 2 or 3 months after you FIRST purchase has been made.


Risks & Challenges

Because of the size of the initial space it will make it very difficult to cater for large amounts of visitors. 
I will have to operate as a pick up / pop up shop where you can collect and try on your items that interest you from looking at the online shop. Passing traffic is more than welcome but people must be aware that at times the shop might be full and will have to wait in the other space, there is plenty to look at in the gallery whilst waiting.
Opening hours will need to coincide with the other members of the space. I will man the space most days but at times when I am the only person in the building, entry will be via a buzzer at the main door. Kind of cool actually and makes it very exclusive!
There will initially be no music in the space because the space is sectioned and shared by other people. I also need a music licence and I'm not willing to pay for that unless the music is a substantial part of the shop. This is why headphones will be supplied to anybody using the creative suite. Music will become a huge part of the shop once I have upgraded into a larger room enclosed with doors.
Sizing and variety. I only source and handpick 100% authentic retro & vintage products. This means that the products are extremely exclusive and will not come in size runs. There will be one off items and the stock will be updated pretty much every week. The independent brands will try to be made available in size runs as these are made to order.


GOALS & OTHER IDEAS.

I have some very specific goals to reach to keep this project fresh and ambitious. I also welcome new ideas and suggestions to improve any part of the project.
  • An efficient marketing campaign spreading across local venues such as Adrenaline Alley, The Core at Corby Cube, Tresham College, Connect FM, Cabvertising, The Compound and The Rooftop Gallery. Regular paid Facebook advertising targeting the local area within a 15 mile radius based on relevant interests in the arts, fashion, clothing and young people.
  • A homeless clothing service where homeless people of Corby can access clean daily clothing, donated by local organisations and contributed to by the shop.
  • A music section promoting local artists and selling copies of their music in the shop. A record section where music lovers can buy exclusive vinyl, dig through the crates and listen to the records on turntables provided in the shop.
  • Auction/ Catwalk evenings where locals can bid on extra special items and other vintage wear bought in from the shop. Accompanied by light food and musical entertainment on the night. An opportunity for local brands to showcase their work on a catwalk style show too.
  • Surprise retro bundle box competitions given out to regular loyal customers, filled with several vintage wear treats.
  • Eventual high street premises situated in the high street benefiting from passing traffic and an expanding shop.


CREDITS

I want to give a massive thanks to everyone who has given some input so far via the social media, the local community and existing customers. 
I understand that times are hard for everyone and making a funding donation is not on the top ten list of things to do, but, I promise you that each and every gesture will go towards making a big impact and help build the foundations for what could potentially open up many many doors for the local people.
If this project is successfully funded solely by the people then that alone is something to be proud of. This project will contain a little piece of everyone in Corby and can stand it's ground against all the mainstream, greedy competitors we see on the high-street. 
Thank-you for your time.

O C Thomas ( The OCT Brand & 50 Foot Drop )
hello@theoctbrand.com www.theoctbrand.com  07415275141

Passing traffic is more than welcome but people must be aware that at times the shop might be full and will have to wait in the other space, there is plenty to look at in the gallery whilst waiting.
Opening hours will need to coincide with the other members of the space. I will man the space most days but at times when I am the only person in the building, entry will be via a buzzer at the main door. Kind of cool actually and makes it very exclusive!
There will initially be no music in the space because the space is sectioned and shared by other people.  I also need a music licence and I'm not willing to pay for that unless the music is a substantial part of the shop. This is why headphones will be supplied to anybody using the creative suite. Music will become a huge part of the shop once I have upgraded into a larger room enclosed with doors.
Sizing and variety. I only source and handpick 100% authentic retro & vintage products. This means that the products are extremely exclusive and will not come in size runs. There will be one off items and the stock will be updated pretty much every week. The independent brands will try to be made available in size runs as these are made to order.


GOALS & OTHER IDEAS.
I have some very specific goals to reach to keep this project fresh and ambitious. I also welcome new ideas and suggestions to improve any part of the project.


An efficient marketing campaign spreading across local venues such as Adrenaline Alley, The Core at Corby Cube, Tresham College, Connect FM, Cabvertising, The Compound and The Rooftop Gallery. Regular paid Facebook advertising targeting the local area within a 15 mile radius based on relevant interests in the arts, fashion, clothing and young people.

A homeless clothing service where homeless people of Corby can access clean daily clothing, donated by local organisations and contributed to by the shop.

A music section promoting local artists and selling copies of their music in the shop. A record section where music lovers can buy exclusive vinyl, dig through the crates and listen to the records on turntables provided in the shop.

Auction/ Catwalk evenings where locals can bid on extra special items and other vintage wear bought in from the shop. Accompanied by light food and musical entertainment on the night. An opportunity for local brands to showcase their work on a catwalk style show too.

Surprise retro bundle box competitions given out to regular loyal customers, filled with several vintage wear treats.

Eventual high street premises situated in the high street benefiting from passing traffic and an expanding shop.



CREDITS

I want to give a massive thanks to everyone who has given some input so far via the social media, the local community and existing customers. 
I understand that times are hard for everyone and making a funding donation is not on the top ten list of things to do, but, I promise you that each and every gesture will go towards making a big impact and help build the foundations for what could potentially open up many many doors for the local people.
If this project is successfully funded solely by the people then that alone is something to be proud of. This project will contain a little piece of everyone in Corby and can stand it's ground against all the mainstream, greedy competitors we see on the high-street. 
Thank-you for your time.

O C Thomas ( The OCT Brand & 50 Foot Drop )
hello@theoctbrand.com www.theoctbrand.com  07415275141

story:
Hello there,

 My name is Max and I am the founder of Woody Comb Co. We produce laser cut and engraved combs that are finished by hand. They are stylish and unique, yet functional and can be taken anywhere. They are all natural, made from Birch wood, 100% sustainable and plastic free. The combs make great gifts for events such as bachelor parties and business promotions (custom engraving available), or can also be used as your new go-to comb! Ranging in styles from a classic comb, hair pick, or even a mustache comb, we provide a product that anyone and everyone can enjoy.

The Surfboard 


About myself; I am a teenage college student majoring in Computer Science. I have always had an admiration for entrepreneurs and their different ways to make a living. After lots of thought and inspiration from my family's entrepreneurship, I came up with Woody Comb Co. The idea behind Woody Comb Co. is to provide a stylish, hand crafted, all natural, grooming comb at an affordable price, without any plastic waste. As of right now we have five different designs and new ones are in development. We plan on making them even more fun and unique!


The Stache 


The problem we face is that our equipment is not large enough to process large orders. On top of that, I am a full time student and work multiple jobs to make ends meet. I have a passion for this company and someday hope to work this business full time. We strive to grow as large as possible and with your help, we can achieve this goal much quicker and launch Woody Comb Co. into the grooming industry!

The Original


Where will your money go?
  • A larger Laser Machine to process more orders effectively
  • Research and Development of new materials and designs
  • Costs of Materials
  • Improvement of Packaging
  • Advertisement and Growth

The Pick

What will you get?
As donations increase, donors will receive a selection of combs, custom designs and soon to be made apparel. At set amounts, donors names will be recognized on our website as well!

What if you can't donate?
  • You could spread the message and make some noise about our campaign!
  • You can use the Indiegogo share tools!
  • You can mention us to your friends and family!

The Original With Ribbon Design

Woody Comb Co. has the potential to become a growing trend in stylish grooming products. This company has the opportunity to grow vastly and become more than just a small manufacturer. Spreading the name and the awesomeness of these combs is the key to success. It must be a Woody or else it's not the same! The only thing stopping us is that we do not have adequate equipment or funding for the materials and packaging. With your help we will become a known name and everyone will be talking about their Woody!

I sincerely thank you for your help and support in making my dream become a reality.

- Max



Please feel free to visit our website or email us with any questions.

www.woodycombco.com

info@woodycombco.com

story:
What is this really all about? Promoting a great product and at the same time giving back to a soldier. Once you back our project with a donate a pair, we will send a card like the one below to the soldier who will receive your donation pair of glasses. In turn upon receiving the soldier can then thank you himself for your generous gift.


Inspired by the uncompromising hazards from the battlefield to the shooting ranges on home soil, VYPR Ballistic sought out the best personnel and manufactures to design and develop some of the top of the line eyewear protection.  

To execute this plan we had aligned ourselves with a decorated Army Staff Sergeant from the 101st Military Police Company Air Assault team. With his insight and help VYPR was able to launch a brand of premium eyewear for tactical, sport and safety applications. VYPR handpicked industry experts in the field of eyewear who have traveled the globe to collaborate on manufacturing solutions with renowned factories to produce our brand products. If you are a firearms shooting enthusiast, hunter, sports lover, etc., you can count on these to protect your eyes from impact.

VYPR ASSAULT (Armor For Your Eyes)

PRODUCT DESCRIPTION ASSAULT- LIFETIME WARRANTY  

  • Subdued black frame with smoke lens 
  • Meets all ANSI & MILSPEC 32432 ballistic standards. 
  • Adjustable non slip nose piece Interlocking lens system 
  •  VyprTek ballistic lens featuring ANTI fog & scratch resistant coating 
  •  Lifetime Guarantee 
  •  Kit includes: ballistic clear shield lens, microfiber cleaning bag and case.

Our Military style Assault shield incorporates “VYPR Tek” lens technology into this ballistic matte black frame. Featuring and interlocking anti-fog lens system and adjustable non-slip nose piece for comfort. VYPR ASSAULT meets all Ansi & Milspec 32432 ballistic standards. All of our eyewear products come with a lifetime guarantee.

Our Assault glasses have been tested by Colt Laboratories one of the top testing and research laboratories in the country to be fully in the guidelines with the US military Mil-Spec standards. 

 Our ASSAULT Kits comes with a matte black finish Ballistic frame, Grey lens, clear lens, Micro fabric bag, hard shell case and lifetime warranty card.

22 Caliber projectile with ZERO penetration

More importantly, we feel that our soldiers who are on the battle fields right now need this kind of protection.  VYPR is calling upon everyone to help us get a pair of VYPR in the hands of all our military people.

VYPR wants to accomplish this with a buy one and give one campaign. You contribute to a pair and VYPR will donate a pair of VYPR glasses to a soldier through their commanding officers.

Additionally, we would like to offer a buy one give one ( of our sport edition glasses) to  military spouses.

SPORT EDITION GLASSES

Those who trust in the products we put out there

 Our Donation Project

We feel very strongly in helping those who are fighting for all of us here in the states and overseas in combat. They  are sacrificing so much for us including being away from their family and friends. These donations are a small part of what we can do and should be doing for these brave men and women. Below are a few of the recipients of our donated glasses program.


Risks & Challenges

This is a win win offer. You are guaranteed to receive your product that comes with a lifetime guarantee.

Our product has arrived from production in a minimal amounts. We are seeking your support so we may be able to order additional inventory for our Buy one Give one project we believe so much in.

Additionally, we would like to offer a buy one give one ( of our sport edition glasses) to a military spouse or military partner.

Join us to fund this project so we can give back to our military people who are keeping us safe with their efforts.


Other Ways You Can Help

If you are unable to contribute, we ask for your help to get the word out across your social media sites for those who may be able to help the cause.

story:
***NOTE: Regardless of whether the campaign reaches its goal, anyone who buys perks from us WILL GET THEM at the set delivery date!***

Features of the xWatch and xWatch Lite (xWatch Only Features Appear in Italics):

Available in Black, Red, Blue, Green

 

It's a Phone, or 2 -- The xWatch is an actual standalone phone when you insert a micro SIM card into the watch. Make calls directly from xWatch with no need for a phone. In addition, you can simultaneously pair your existing mobile device to xWatch allowing you make and receive calls from both numbers through one device (xWatch ONLY).

Take Pictures and Video -- xWatch is one of the only smartwatches with a built-in camera and video camera. xWatch camera functionality includes night mode, different camera settings, and the ability to use the xWatch as a remote control to control your Android smartphone camera (great for selfies!)

Blood Pressure Monitor -- keep track of your blood pressure with the built in monitor (xWatch).

Store & Listen To Music -- xWatch’s built-in audio player gives you the ability to listen to music, either stored on your phone, or stored on xWatch’s huge 8GB internal memory, right from the watch on its built-in speaker or you can pair it to bluetooth earphones for more private listening.

Health & Fitness Monitoring -- xWatch can track all of your fitness activity including steps walked, calories burned and more. xWatch is also one of the most convenient devices to use while training. Don’t carry your heavy phone around when running or exercising, instead wear xWatch.

Pair to Any Phone -- Easy pairing to your iOS or Android device using xWatch’s built-in QR code scanner or bluetooth control screen and with xWatch’s bluetooth notifier receive all alerts from your mobile phone on xWatch via sound or vibration alerts (when paired to mobile phone).

x2 Wireless Headset - We have developed the perfect bluetooth headset for the xWatch. It can be used for listening to music, or answering calls. The x2 headset paired with the xWatch is the ultimate combo for working out or anything else you don't want your actual phone for. Stay in touch without a phone with xWatch and the x2 Wireless Headset. 

Apps - get access to 1000s of apps with xWatch.

 

What We Need & What You Get

  • We are looking for $10,000 in funding to bring this awesome smartwatch to market and make it available to everyone.
  • Our perks include the xWatch, xWatch Lite, and x2 Wireless Headset
  • If we do not reach our goal, we will still be manufacturing our product in large quantities and get it out to as many people. 

Why xWatch?

Why is the xWatch Family of products better than other smartwatches:

  • We want to create a smartwatch that actually can be used like a smartphone for an affordable price so that everyone can own one.

Risks & Challenges

The main challenges/risks we face our the ability to continue getting the rubber blend for the material used in the watch strap. We have backup suppliers and are communicating with them now to make sure that we do not run into this problem.

Other Ways You Can Help

  • Get the news about this amazing watch out to your friends.

story:
Go to: OrigamoApparel.com

 

 

... is a young clothing brand for men with a clear concept: we make High Quality, Organic and Fair Menswear.

Fund our campaign to get one or more of the first ever batch of Pacific Polos, and become an early explorer in the journey from Fast Fashion to Organic and Fair Fashion.

Our first design, the Pacific Polo Collection sets the Organic and Fair Fashion standard!

It is 100% made with luxurious Organic Pima Cotton from Peru, dyed with tested non-harmful dyes, and manufactured in our partner Fair Factories that we have personally toured in Lima Peru.

Our millennial founder, Nicolas, felt under his skin the need for change in the apparel industry when he realized that, despite an obvious decrease in the quality of the products, our clothing production backyard was a total mess.

The apparel industry is the 2nd most polluting in the world, second only to the oil industry, and labor abuses and modern slavery are alive in this field.

There are other (better!) ways to produce garments! This is what we are all about at Origamo!

At Origamo we make things differently: in our process, Care for the Environment and Fair Production are essential components of our product specification starting from day one, and are as vital as factors like quality, style, and price.

With your support, Origamo wants to change the clothing industry for the better, making it Organic and Fair to demonstrate that positive corporate culture should not come at the detriment of the product quality, and can be a pillar of a more human and sustainable society.

Join us in this Journey! This campaign serves as a launch pad for the brands, and its proceeds will be used to add new colors and to develop new models to promote Organic and Fair Fashion.

 

In this Campaign Origamo offers you to get one or more Pacific Polos from the first batch ever.

Thanks to friends and family, we have been able to finance this small production of Pacific Polos, and we want to spread them all over the world to show that Organic and Fair Fashion works and can give great results.


This is Origamo's take-off, therefore through the campaign perks we are very happy to propose our Pacific Polo Collection with the following welcome sweeteners:

  • Free shipping fees in the US
  • Discounted shipping rate for Canada and Europe
  • $20 OFF (20% OFF) for Perks with one Polo.
  • Up to $198 OFF (40% OFF) in total for perks with more than one Polo.

 

Check out the campaign perks to get the different deals.

Some of the perks comes in very limited quantities.

After this campaign the Pacific Polos will only be available in the USA.

 

The production is done and is on its way to our home base in Cambridge MA.

It is expected to arrive before the campaign’s end on Dec 12.

Hence we will deliver for Christmas in the US, and we are also confident about Christmas delivery to the other countries where we ship.

 

Plain White Snow:

Plain Navy:

Plain Crimson Red:

White Snow Evolve:

Navy Contrast White:

Crimson Red Contrast:

 

 

Origamo flower embroidered on the chest:

 

100% Origanic Pima Cotton from Peru:

The Peruvian Pima is a luxury cotton, one of the softest in the world because of its Extra Long Staples, and being Organic it has a much a better environmental footprint than conventional cotton.

The cotton used by Origamo complies with the rules of the U.S. and European Organic standards:

 

 

Yarn colored with Eco-Friendly and Non-Harmful dyes:

Your skin and the environment are protected.

Eco-Friendly and Non-Harmful dyes, since the factory which colors the yarn for the Pacific Polo is GOTS certified and OEKOTEX class I certified for the dyeing operations.

GOTS: The Global Organic Textile Standard is one of the most demanding international processing standards for textiles made from certified organically produced raw materials.

OEKOTEX: The OEKO-TEX® Standard 100 is a worldwide consistent and independent test and certification system for the absence of harmful substances for raw, semi-finished, and finished textile products at all processing levels.

 

Australian Mother of Pearl collar buttons:

Origamo selected the Australian Mother of Pearl for its quality and for the sustainability of its production process.

Each of these buttons is unique and has its own iridescent shine, so on top of the distinction touch they add to any outfit, these Australian Mother of Pearl buttons make each Pacific Polo slightly different, and uniquely yours.

There's one extra Australian MoP button on the inside… for life accidents.

 

Double pique knitting:

Double pique knitting, a fabric structure with higher relief than traditional single pique, allowing for a better quality feel while preserving the garment flexibility and avoiding the boxy effect.

 

Reinforced Uneven side vent:

This American style side vent is made with the same color pique tape and very well finished, and it is reinforced with a bar tag to ensure long lasting quality.

 

 

Size information:
  • Origamo uses American sizes, which usually run larger than Universal sizes used in Europe.
  • You can use the size grid, to compare with some of your current Tee-shirts or Polos.
  • For Europe, you should consider taking the Origamo size one notch below your usual universal size.
  • E.g. Pick an Origamo M if you usually wear a universal L.

If the size does not fit, you can contact us during 15 days after the delivery and we will organize:

  • One size exchange in the US
  • One size exchange or refund elsewhere

We are happy to insure size exchange, because we really want you to be fully satisfied with your Origamo polo.

Please bear in mind anyway that returns have a real cost on our side, hence we would like to encourage you to use the size grid to try to pick your perfect size in the first place.

Thank you very much.

 

The proceeds of this campaign will be fully reinvested in Origamo's journey to change the Fashion industry for the better.

In practice it means that the funds gathered will be fully reinvested in the development of Origamo’s Organic and Fair Fashion concept.

Specifically, the campaign should help with the three following projects:

First, get Origamo certified under the Global Organic Textile Standard (GOTS) for trading operations and related products.

 

Then, add new colors to the Pacific Collection for the summer! We already have prototypes in Light Blue and Salmon, waiting for funding to be produced... and we would warmly welcome any color idea!

 

Finally, initiate the creation process for two new Organic and Fair designs:

  • Organic Pima Tee collection
  • Organic Cotton Sweatshirt Quarter-zip

 

And that’s it, we have a lot on the plate, but we have already started the change in the fashion industry, let’s keep up the good work.

Join us on this Journey to better Fashion, make Origamo your Organic and Fair clothing brand!

 

The polos proposed in the perks are produced and on their way to Origamo's warehouse in Cambridge MA.

Hence we believe that the main challenge at this stage is to be able to get the Polos delivered before Christmas outside of the USA.

We are confident that we will achieve this goal, since our founder has lived in three countries over the last ten years, he is used to shipping many things all over the place, and has many helpful relays in each country where the perks are delivered.

 

If you like this campaign please share it as much as you can!

If you like the concept Origamo Organic and Fair you can like our Facebook page

facebook.com/OrigamoApparel

If you like this campaign and like the concept Origamo... No problemo, share and like! 

You can send your feedback about the campaign, so that we can keep on improving.

Any other information about Origamo on our website: https://OrigamoApparel.com

THANK YOU VERY MUCH FOR ALL YOUR SUPPORT!

 

© 2016 Origamo
